D8cG7WmEC7fMmiFJPbdRjA.text: Just like their name, these burgers are honest! I come here when I want more of a plain (not saucy) honest burger. Don't forget to order the rosemary chips and a beer on the side.

GjhzJ-YBoNLn1acRJVDRCw.text: Visited London this summer and was yelping good places to eat in the soho district and came across honest burgers. For a UK establishment, 4/12 stars and 92 reviews is pretty impressive seeing as yelp is not used as proximately as in the US. I ordered the honest burger and asked for it cooked medium but it still came out on the pink side. Now, i'm not in my native country so i'm not comfortable with things being undercooked but I decided to just go ahead with it anyways. The burger was tender and i liked the bun. It was nothing I hadn't had back in california, but overall still a good quality burger. The fries which everyone seems to be a fan of were too "gingery" for my taste. There is a definitely a strong taste of ginger.. and the lemonade was not very good either, didn't taste like real lemonade. Overall it was a decent meal but for 12 pounds, i would explore my options.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. honest burger with lemonade!

dsCSmJjaLuHb0PFsvck2aw.text: Burger was pretty good and service fast but place is tiny and not the cleanest. Staff only so so, seemed like they were stressed out with the conditions. A bigger venue would help a lot.

b4MfT7QS4eabsQxfe_74QQ.text: Well, I've just written that it was not easy to find a really, really good burger in London, although there are thousands of burger restaurants. Honest Burgers, however, is very close to what I really like.I love the tiny size of the burgers. For the first time, I haven't felt bad for having eaten a  whole burger. It was delicious and it felt good to eat "honest" food. The chips were great (I think their secret is rosemary). The homemade lemonade is refreshing and yummy.So to be honest: One of the things I miss about London is Honest Burgers in Soho.

RbzYaYBHjo7T81mz61BsMg.text: I've been a regular of the Brixton Market branch since it opened. The food was constantly good and those chips are delicious.However, the Soho branch was a disappointment. It certainly didn't match the quality that characterises Honest Burgers in Brixton Market and it didn't have the artisan feeling that was for granted in the Brixton branch. It is a shame as I can sense how this is trying to become yet another generic burger chain.Also, 1.50 for 1 slice of courgette? A bit too much, even for Soho.

_mzBv1uaQx2dgO5AbPI9mA.text: Oh god, I hate myself for this. Truly, I do. But these burgers were not as good as MeatLiquor. Okay, with that unpleasantness out of the way, I admit that I will likely go back here before going back to MeatLiquor. The ambiance is way better. The vibe is less LOUD CLUB BURGER TRENDY PANTS QUEUE FOREVER HAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHA and more hey, come, relax, have a burger. If they don't have a table, they'll take your number and call you. You can go to any nearby pub. There is no anxiety to get there at stupid o'clock for fear of having to stand outside to wait for your dinner as a sign of the restaurant's desirability.And even though we were told 45 minutes for a table, it took no more than 10. Which meant that I had to finish my lager VERY quickly, but there are worse fates in life.I'm still giving this five stars because it was really just so freaking enjoyable. The staff was great from beginning to end. Really friendly. It's cozy and unpretentious. There isn't f'ing paint and noise and fugly thrown all over the walls to look like, I don't know, an East Village basement metal bar? I don't even know what that decor is going for. Anyhooz, the beer is also good. I'm so glad there's an Honest Burger in Soho now. OH! And the fries!!! Those fries are incredible and deserve so many stars and kisses on their own.

86tR2YroBn6AqeKAY-fxRQ.text: Really nice burger and amazing service! I truly enjoy the time I spent there! Good prices as well! I recommend to everybody to go there at least once!

c2_SqVVn6LVRiNoAOYYFDg.text: Ate here on a Wednesday night and the wait was one hour and a half. However, the wait was well worth it. I would suggest putting your name in and going to one of the surrounding pubs to get a drink while you wait. I believe they even have an app you can download that let's you see your place in the cue. The burger was nothing short of spectacular. Onion rings are average however the rosemary chips are mouth watering. Decent beer selection as well. If you are in the area and want a good burger and chips, this is your stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Delicious pale ale.

pooCAOIHIootFGzbhFvQjA.text: I have only been once to the one in Kings Cross and to be honest I was quite disappointed. The menu was tiny with not much choice and the burger was nothing to write home about. With so many burger joints around London this is not one I would be rushing back to.

foGv2he-aHpP3O1VE9YtpQ.text: On a never-ending (and incredibly tasty) quest for the best burgers in Britain, Honest Burger was inevitably going to be a stop. But when they were only down in Brixton serving up burgers in a seemingly perpetually crowded shop, I had a little hope of trying them out. Luckily, the new Soho branch is tucked away off Dean St and hasn't yet been noticed by the vast crowds who typically roam those streets in search of food.After a morning of intense training in Regent's Park followed by some highly entertaining shopping in the local charity shops, I popped into Honest Burger for a well deserved bite. I had the intention of trying out the namesake burger (bacon, cheese, and onions on an all-beef patty) but the cute waitress seduced me away with the special. This decadent dish was a black pudding and beef patty with a smoky brown sauce and a sweet apple tempura (which I initially thought was an onion ring!) served with HB's house chips.The burger was good with rich meaty flavours from the beef boosted by the black pudding. The black pudding supported the meat rather than hiding it but I'll have to try a standard beef burger there to really talk about the meat itself. Needless to say, it was a juicy tasty patty that I thoroughly enjoyed. The apple tempura was a new element for me and the sweetness of the apple helped balance out the richness of the patty. I'm not sure what exactly the sauce was, but it helped keep the patty moist and tied everything together. The bun was a win with the soft bread absorbing the sauce and juices although it did fall apart in the last few bites causing a small mess. Or maybe that was just me...I never seem to be able to eat without getting my hands a little dirty.I washed it all down with a delicious Samuel Smith Pale Ale served in massive bottles. I've never see Samuel Smith before (being much more familiar with Sam Adams) but a good brew for sure.Last, and definitely not least, were the chips. Wow...just wow. These are by far the best chips I've ever tried. Not just in Britain...I mean ever! And I've gone through Hawksmoor's beef dripping chips, Heston's triple cooked chips, and made dozens of variations on my own (what can I say...I love chips!). But after just one, you know why HB insists on serving a portion with each burger. Hell, I'd come back here just for the chips!So I probably should tell you why. These chips are imbued with rosemary. You can see the flecks of rosemary on each crispy wafer and you can smell it wafting out of the kitchen. It's amazing how good rosemary and potato tastes. The chip itself was crispy on the outside yet fluffy so fluffy inside to a degree that implied double or maybe even triple cooking. The full flavours of the rosemary made my mouth water and they were salted just perfectly. The bottle of ketchup provided was almost an insult to the quality of chip served.Overall, for £12 for the burger and chips (normal burgers range from £7-9...the special was £12), it's an excellent value offering. On the burger alone, I'd give it the #3 spot under Patty & Bun and Kimchi Cult, but when judged as a package with chips it's definitely at the top.

_Tw_uilCOSmUP_yLXRzx4g.text: A few weeks ago, Nida K and I were in Soho in need of a meal to sustain us while we were on a big pre-holidays shopping trip. She suggested Honest Burger, saying that the Louisiana burger had been recommended. I'm always up for a good hamburger, so I was excited to give Honest Burger a chance.We got lucky, as we were able to get a table right as we walked in, though we were toward the end of the lunch hour on a Saturday. It's probably the kind of place where you should get a reservation if you can, or be prepared to wait. The Louisiana burger was no longer on the menu, but if I remember correctly, there was something involving chorizo and spiciness as the new 'seasonal' option, so I was glad to give it a chance instead. The burger was great--juicy and messy and rich in flavour. The rosemary fries were also delicious. We had water to drink, but there was a sumptuous lemonade that I saw at other tables and will definitely be giving a chance the next time I stop by.Service was good, and the atmosphere was quaint and funky. I liked all of the warmth and wood feeling--it was unique but not trying to be something fancy, just a good place for a good burger.

eOTAcC9_MX4UlQXHiUe2zw.text: Stick a tasty, sloppy piece of prime beef in a brioche bun these days and you get to be called a culinary genius.... especially if you make people queue and don't take reservations. Such is the way with London dining in 2013. Bah Humbug. But you don't fool me, I think you need to go the extra step to realistically be in with a shout of 4 or more stars if you're marketing yourself as some burger experience. GBK and Byron have been around for a decade and still are decent. Why do we need Honest Burgers? Is GBK's delicious Kiwi-burger secretly telling us lies and mugging us behind our backs?Why we need Honest Burger is revealed once you've had your first few bites sitting in the little restaurant. We need it because it's a worthwhile combination of good meat, chips, soft drinks and a nice family-feel atmosphere. Just make sure you don't go at a busy time. Waiting is annoying, even if Guinness say otherwise

Jz_cRpPVhO6kn3ZRivT-9Q.text: Great food. I was surprised but they had reasonably priced gluten free burgers, fries, and even onion rings! Definitely recommend!

3cDtM44hRA7T1GKn3bJrmA.text: This is probably the best burger I've had in London in 4 months (during which I pretty much only eat burgers when dining out). I'll admit, I haven't tried anything other than their traditional beef Honest burger - but why would you try new things when you've already found something delicious? Juicy, thick patty - tastes like America. ;)The fries are scarily addictive, I love the rosemary seasoning. And try the homemade lemonade. Perfect meal!Fair warning though, this place has an impossibly long wait-list during weekend dinners. On one disappointing occasion, some friends and I waited for a table for nearly an hour before we gave in and went to a nearby restaurant instead. Well AFTER we had finished our meal, we received a call from Honest Burgers saying our table was finally ready. Fail.

9ODZDjtBMVsxN1-ZM5htnA.text: great burgers and fries. friendly staff. fast service as well.however, was a bit pricey. 15 euros for a burger and fries.also had to wait outside while table was being prepared and the outdoor heaters are not the strongest.

HmFE6c4RNyLEnfn_zGBnaA.text: Really good food, nice atmosphere, but pricey for us. We are used to paying about $5 to $10 for a good burger in the U.S., but here the burgers are 10 pounds or about $15 for a burger.

xfTxmN0yLFNTIekYSH_e3Q.text: Brilliant. On my visit to London I was in search for a good burger. In all honesty, I was in search for a great burger. Many bloggers that I trust point to this little place in Soho. From the time we enter all the good signs were there; the limited variety of different burgers (a sign that they are purists and they know that a good burger contains so many things), the default cooking for the burger that is medium "pink" (a sign that they are proud about their meat) and lastly the pace of the plates emptying all around us. I had the honest burger and it was as good as expected. A little disclosure: I classify a burger as great when a feeling of sadness comes along with the last bite. Here that was precisely the case, along with a feeling of certainty that for my rest couple of days in London I will revisit it for sure to keep the memory of this place as fresh and as pink as their burger was. Highly recommended.

VnqsfdU9emOPKyilXFQlIA.text: As an American I am on the hunt for the best burger in London that could equate to the burgers in NYC. After a 40 min wait to get a table for two, the wait was worth it. These burgers are very tasty! Still not quite to the likes of shake shack or corner bistro but is the closest I have come so far. Bonus points to a honest burgers for providing gluten free buns. It is always a rare treat to be able to enjoy my meat patty with a bun when one has Celiacs.The ginger beer was very spicy yet sweet and enjoyed that it was served in a Mason Jar.The fries (chips) were full of a salty rosemary flavor and even though I was full I managed to eat them all. Also huge plus that the fries came with the price of the burger rather than having to order them separately. Will definitely be making another trip here as it is much cheaper than burger and lobster which is a stones throw away for the same quality of food.

6o1tx8DZOClcA7yCmeP43g.text: I have been a local to the Honest Burger based in Brixton and I'm so glad it is branching out into central London.This is still small consider its location. As per usual there's always a queue even though this has just been opened & located on a quiet side street in Soho.Their burger is amazing. I like it medium but my partner found it too rare. The rosemary chips melts in your mouth. It is delish!!!!! :) Highly recommended. Value for money. So what are you waiting for? Go try it!

UMgdL21PiK3VwpmrUea8cg.text: I had the house special with the house beer. It reminded me very much of In 'n Out's Animal Style burger with the mustard being on the grill.

axiNjP2ALgH5tNDBg2PhYQ.text: Coming from America where it's known to have the best burgers, it was nice to see that London has it's one bespoke burger joint and I was eager to try it out. Going on a Saturday night we had to wait almost 2 hours. Yes, 2 hours. Even though they give you the freedom go elsewhere to wait (they call you), 2 hours is too long for burgers. We ordered the house special and I liked how the burger was a good size, and the patty was really juicy and fresh. The fries were decent and they have a good drinks selection because you can really chill there and enjoy the homey decor. The experience was overall nice and the burgers were good... but I wished it was better due to the wait, unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

EEpE0tZZkAPgyMobxvkprw.text: It should be three stars, but it's four.Why?Well, a burger seems to cost a tenner these days, whether or not you're getting it from O'Neill's pubs or any of the many new burger shops (except the infamous £20 Burger and Lobster burger but we won't even go there).If you're going to spend a tenner on a burger you may as well go to Honest. They're always doing different things which are always excellent, and the rosemary chips are grand.Better food for the same price than any of the midsize chains doing less good food for more money.

P2fvql-oZWTvb8ODkKfVCQ.text: Finally, a burger place that does not neglect vegetarians in any way, shape, or form. When I read the ingredients of Honest Burgers' "fritter", I was a tad skeptical. The individual ingredients were not necessarily ones I tend to enjoy, and I've been to a fair share of burger places that don't believe vegetarians are within their target audience and therefore do not make an effort when it comes to vegetarian options. So, I was skeptical to say the least. Boy was I wrong. I would DIE for this fritter -- it was everything I wanted in a meal and more. Their fritters are also off the beaten path of vegetarian substitutes, which is always welcome. I would recommend the fritter to anyone with tastebuds, not just vegetarians. This is not something I think of as a "passable substitute" since I do not eat meat -- this is something I'd travel across the city to have for dinner (which I have done).The service at Honest Burgers was also well-coordinated, professional, and timely. The first time my friend and I ate there we were in a rush to see a performance, and despite the crowd the employees seated, served, and got the check for us in excellent time. This is one of my favorite places to eat in London!

KERy0uTLKRffXQ3YB7Dk5w.text: I arrived at 11:45 (opening time) with my friends running a bit late. The friendly/enthusiastic staff said it was cool for me to come in and hold a table. Usually in these small trendy places, I'd be told that we could only be seated once everyone arrived, but being the first customer of the day I guess they took pity on me. Bonus!I ordered the Honest Burger (cheese and smoked bacon) cooked medium-well. It was tasty, but to be 'honest' (see what I did there), it lacked that juiciness that you'd get from a Patty & Bun or Shake Shack burger. Their menu says they're cooked medium/pink unless otherwise requested, but I always have them medium-well, so the additional cooking time couldn't have dried it out.The thin rustic chips (skin on) with rosemary were surprisingly addictive...and a great big heap of them too. Everything was serving in a camping style enamel plate (not a fan!), but I guess its way better than just greaseproof-paper like the other trendoid burger joints.I'd give the burgers 3-stars and the chips 5-stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Original Honest Burger (onion relish, cheddar, smoked bacon)

9NSiidu0DWr9tSyARzHxdQ.text: One of the best burgers I've had in my life. And the fries are magnificent. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a delicious burger.

EoLTk4l5lCMRHV8fmETt_A.text: In the latest stop in my London tour of HB locations, I find myself in Soho. Pretty great, considering a few of my faves (wahaca, Bone Daddies) are also nearby. It's also a stone's throw from Burger&Lobster, so keep that in mind if you're given a two-hour wait like I've been both times I've tried going.On a Sunday evening, there was still a 30 min wait. Luckily, they employ their other locations' system of taking your phone number and texting you when your table is almost ready, and again when it IS ready (convenient if you've ordered a drink at a nearby bar and now need to down it and pay).I was perhaps a little too excited to try what I had come to believe was the greatest mash-up since Bowie and Mercury - the BrewDog burger. Spotted it on the menu, but I had to ask about the special beer served on the side (burger alone is £11; and £15 for the special, which is a £3 discount on the bottle of Bourbon Baby).Sadly, I wasn't all that into it. The candied bacon wasn't crispy, but sloggy and dripping in the BBQ that was liberally applied. The BBQ was already fairly sweet, so I don't know that the "candied" bacon (or the sweet sautéed onions for that matter) really added anything to this other than that it looks pretty good on paper. So this one wasn't for me, but I should have known given my recent life choice of being a burger purist.I didn't mean for this to be a review of a specific burger rather than this new HB location, so I'll note that service was excellent - quick and friendly - this location has slightly more seating than the Camden and Brixton ones. As such, it def feels less unique/indie/cozy. Sigh, can't have it all I 'spose.

VoXZOUEIzSOEqHnj5hUZ-Q.text: Usually I love this place. Seems I love the one at Kings cross.Atmosphere Crammed in, rustic soho style, fashions itself on the 70s school type tables and chairs. And getting a lot.out of the space.StaffInconsistent. One member of staff was spot on, then another was friendly but Obviously stressed and a bit overworked. I will forgive the undercooked burger as they had a trainee on the grill, seemed for a Friday at 2.30 they were still rushed.FoodI think I went in on an off day. Burger was undercooked, I didn't get my salad, I seemed to get the dregs of the chips (third the size fries). Gluten free Burger bun was not as yummy as usual. I saw my friends fritter, they could work on the vegetarian option. I think it was a bad day.SummaryAlright... Could do with more staff and more space, or fewer chairs. Ill be going to Kings cross branch nezt time.

uN8RhoqFDSCUzfVUAoEUpQ.text: If there is one thing a burger place is for, it is for filtering people on first dates into two types of people: 1) hands on, face first, or 2) halve & nibble. Its located near Kings X station, so you can politely escape from anyone who is of the No. 2 personality type.Honest Burger does simplicity very well, and that is a good thing. Plus, its one of the few 'high-end' burger joints that serve (quite lovely rosemary salted) friends included in the price of their burgers.+ Pick a meat or veg, pick one of 1-3 options, or a special. Done, blam, get it in your mouth. In fairness its a rare occasion I say it, but ALL of the burgers are good. + Chipotle mayonnaise is delicious, and very more-ish.+ Decent selection of beers (I had The Honest Pale Ale from Beavertown) served in a chilled tulip-glass.+Kick-ass staff. 'Honestly', if there is an option for an Honest Burger near you when you are craving, go there. Its far better than the majority out there claiming to be burger wunderkinds. And is definitely a lot less grott/greasy/dark than MEATmarket.

kb1K-nyRtjEF709lFDLX-g.text: I ordered a plain £8 beef burger. The meat came cold, nothing special about the meat.Chips was special and very good.Staff is friendly and vibe is nice, although - I told the waitress about the cold burger and she haven't done nothing.NOT even close to be on my TOP 50 burger joints at the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Cold burger, hot fries. WTF
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The restaurant, Tuesday 9:30pm

hpdRy_OW8BxPtwKrhpAS0Q.text: Whats the point of rating this other than to get it off of my list of places i've visited reminding me to leave a review. Its awesome. Consistently good. And I couldn't ask for more. I've been to a shit ton of pop ups, fallen in LOVE and then had my heart BROKEN by inconsistency and lack luster burgers. This is like my go-to burger spot that never fails me, always helps me move when I need to, always supplys the truck too, fills me up, makes me happy when i'm sad, they're best boyfriend of burgers!

I4t3RJKT6Roongz6gM-nHQ.text: This place was awesome. There was such a great vibe in the restaurant, in which is very important to me! Very upbeat with a hint of quaint to even in out. The burger was brilliant cooked perfectly, extremely succulent and tasty! Highly recommend coming here!

CrWaFghlVFMuBd8g7r5s5w.text: Heard of the queues so made it to the restaurant before doors opened. Sure enough, there were people there with the same idea. Once seated, ordered the "beef honest" burger. When the order came, it was a bit of a whomp whomp moment. The burger is quite small in size. To be fair it did fill me up, but that's because I cleaned up the fries that came with and drank 5 cups of water. I think should be slightly bigger or at least fill up the burger with more of the dressing so it doesn't look so empty and a bit sad. The taste was good and I liked it because for whatever the name of the place is worth, it sold me- "Honest" Burger. I'm a stickler when it comes to ground meat/beef patties/factory processed meats. So when the website says the meats are supplied by Ginger Pig, I'm already engaged. When I choose to buy meat, I support farmers that grow stress free cows with a hay and grass diet. Staff was nice but a bit slow. Would help if they were a bit more attentive as we were trying to get their attention many times but they would walk right pass. Overall the meal was good and I like the quality.  I'd visit again when I'm craving a burger.

IAegUf0DPFezk5uEdJ3Zgg.text: Tasty burgers + crispy fries + tasteful homemade beer = Happiness!! If you are a fan of this equation, you have to go to this place!!

ZPgClHPuTmsCKcVD1Pu_Qw.text: Honestly... What's all the fuss about? I do like a good burger and everyone was raving about this place when it first opened but I couldn't justify waiting in the queue for hours back then sooo only just finally decided to give it a go as we had a bit of time to kill and there was only one couple in the "queue".What I mean by "queue" is that there doesn't actually seem to be any organised queue.. You rock up, tell the waiters you want a table for two and then I guess they simply remember the order in which different people came because there wasn't any writing down of names /list or anything.. Thankfully as we were second in line this didn't affect us, but for the 15 or so people that came after, I really wondered how they would all get seated in order...Any who! I'm waffling... THE BURGER! I tried an honest burger seeing as that seemed to be the main thing.. And well ... It's an OK burger. Nothing amazing, or out of the ordinary - I've had tastier burgers at Byron's and Shakeshack tbh. The chips were also OK... The lemonade was nice... The onion rings were pretty tasty... The service was pretty quick so that's a plus... But I just wouldn't queue for more than 15mins to eat here.. It's really nothing that special.Oh the other good thing is that they have gluten free buns! Hurray for coeliacs everywhere!

qyLARqHervuDOomyx6AMbA.text: Honest Burger is a fun burger joint tucked on a quaint street near a district of bars and nightlife. Honest Burger's relaxed atmosphere makes it a perfect place for a date or small gathering with friends. Make sure you put in a reservation, as I was quoted at a 2 hour wait when I visited. I grabbed a beer and explored the nearby neighborhood, as it is in quite a fun part of London. Honest Burger's most popular burger bears their name the "Honest Burger". It features a flavorful patty cooked to order, red onion relish, smoked bacon, mature cheddar, pickled cucumber, and shredded lettuce. Upon receiving my burger, I noticed that there had been no sauce applied. I tried it without sauce thinking the onion relish may be the intended topping. I noted the condiments on the table and quickly added a healthy portion of mayo knowing it would create a rich and creamy effect with the savory red onion relish. After applying the mayo, I had one of the best burgers in London in my hands. AMAZING bacon that is amongst some of the best I have had in all my travels (best bacon in London, so far). Compared to the very best burgers I've had the bun was a little too toasted and the beef was not quite as juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Honest Burger

MSvjMabQ3X_0mY_iaJU16Q.text: Seriously probably the best burger I have ever put in my mouth! Their chips were delicious and seasoned perfectly with rosemary, I personally ordered their burger from their specials board and besides the fact that the burger itself was cooked to perfection, the infused bacon gravy that accompanied it was absolutely delectable! Highly recommended!

O2NKzhMvGGan7CZrrdbytQ.text: Gotta say, it's definitely the best burger I had in London, and it's also in the top 5 casual burgers I've every had.  Perfectly soft meat with loads of beefiness and flavor.  Each bite just perfect.  Soft delicious toasted bun that matches the meat in size.  Very nicely done burger.Rosemary chips were really good as well.  Definitely a winner.Will be back for sure.  Thank you Honest Burger.

UAFrUEbNGwAT-_axLQVZSw.text: These burgers are juicy and the fries are crisp. Setting is inside the Brixton market. You can't go wrong here.

MISgidEOV3o84Vnm773K4Q.text: Since this little place opened near our work, it's been a great hit. The burgers are delicious, the fries even more delicious, and service is really quick and efficient.The fact that the menu is really simple is great, as it makes ordering quick.The only downside is that it is quite small and always packed, so you may have to wait for a while before being seated and if you are sitting down you may feel like you have to leave sooner than you would like!

9mmVyaKQWz0Wc9J6YW9ogQ.text: It is a great place for a burger. Bit small, but turn around is really fast. I had the special burger, good burger, but don't know if it's £11,00 good. Fries are AMAZING. Normally I don't eat them, but they are addictive. And I had a beer, specially brewed for Honest Burgers. Really good as well.I travel a lot and try to find the best burger place, this is a serious contender!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

g7cbbxPQdYeE25pxOSZWKw.text: I'm doing a personal project to find all the great burgers around London haha. And so far I've been to more than 10 burger joints and "HONEST BURGERS" are the BEST by far.Absolutely love the red onion relish and the rosemary salted chips. The price is decent for London and taste is superb!!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

wTWQ3FF7KNkvtFRgcft22g.text: Great service. Really good food. Burgers were cooked at medium and were juicy. Chips were crisp and tasty. Highly recommend.

QWw20Zp4nJTswV2s7K2iHA.text: Meaty om nom nom nom!This is why you must head over to honest burgers:1. It's cheap2. No queue when I went at lunch time3. Really delicious, meaty burger that is pink in the middle3. Uber-crunchy chips with rosemary salt4. The relish! Ommygoodness I love the relish!5. Go across the street and read the plaque on the front door (house number 7)! It makes me giggle every time! (How many people must have rung the doorbell looking for a prostitute to make the owners resort to that sign!?) It's like the meaty happiness of meat liquor, BUT less pretentious and I could hear my friend talking. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. An honest burger

kNPaJg0Gzx-jX9XF0fM4pw.text: These burgers, fries, and onion rings are easily some of the best I have ever had in my life.The burgers were juicy gourmet style burgers with various high-end ingredients like smoked ketchup and onion relish.  My wife was only going to heat half and then bring it home, but the next thing I knew her burger was GONE.The rosemary fries were really good.The star of the night, however, had to be the annis-enriched beer batter onion rings.  We LOVE onion rings and consider ourselves conniseurs of such.  These were the best freaking onion rings I've ever had in my life.  It is a small order of only 4 large onion rings for 3.5, but that is my only complaint.  I would have ordered at least two more orders!I also really enjoyed this Iceland white ale they had.  All in all --- an awesome meal.

XlGSCnoPqDI2Jyea93xI1w.text: Wanna have your mind blown?Have a market veggie fritter burger.Served on a hot, slightly toasted bun, the market veggie fritter (cauliflower and other delectable veggies) burger is finished off with a slightly spicy cucumber and yogurt sauce. I died.Taste buds broke.Yum-eeeeeeeeeee. 5 starts no doubt.The onion rings were also pretty effen tasty. Lick-my-fingers-kinda-good.4.5 starsThe rosemary chips (served with the burger)?4 stars. Solid, just not epic.I kinda want this place to blow my mind again, right about now.....

wAlJm8x4yJrswlUtrwsPzw.text: Yes, the burgers here are truly delicious and I am being honest when I say that I enjoyed every next bite as much as the other, honestly. But it's not the burgers I want to speak in praise of, but the delightful fries. The fries come with the burger and are the ideal dream combination, the two things that go together and can't go apart. Well, they could go apart and I wouldn't mind eating the fries alone. Every fry is fresh and neither too dry, nor too greasy. They taste like home-made ones, but in a good way. Also, the service was something that made me an impression since the place was very busy, but the staff managed to take all the orders and still act friendly and welcoming. The place deserves an honest 5.

0EsUWewpI3NkLcvvOa1fuQ.text: This is a very solid burger and if you're going for a non-chain, casual sit down situation I don't think you'll find many better options in the Soho area.Among my burger experiences in London, I'd rate this one toward the top. The onion "jam" and bacon additions, along with the meat cooked to pink, made it a very solid offering. My main criticism were the lack of "optional" toppings (included being tomatoes and eggs, to of my personal favorites). The bun itself is reasonably good, but I also couldn't call it anything particularly standout. Overall, very good burger, very reasonable pricepoint (particularly for London) and great ambience for an informal meal. It's a tiny place, so I recommend going if you're on your own or with a small group; they also don't take reservations but were very nice about letting me sit for a bit while I waited for my friend to join me.As the other reviews mention, the real differentiator here is the rosemary fries (chips, as the Brits would say). They come standard issue with the burgers and sandwiches, and you can also order extra on the side if you are so inclined.See my menu photo for a full representation of this restaurant's offering!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Menus!

GA-F4_g5EldGH5JpE324xg.text: Food was good and so was the service. We came here to eat in between Harry Potter the play pt 1 and 2. While I enjoyed the food it was it a bit greasy and didn't blow my mind but if you want a good burger and are in a rush it's a great place. I did love the chipotle mayo and that was the Star of the show for me!

NdSmwG6S9Sw2XZNOpd4iVw.text: Really good burgers, highly recommended find.I ordered the signature burger and it was very good. The fries were also very good with the signature ketchup options.Also - We had a beet salad very tasty and a good addition.

mUryqQuYgcIHmMZ-38Lmng.text: Great simple menu, great ingredients, fun friendly staff. I appreciate a good burger and they make it in a simple yet flavorful way with a side of chips (fries). I love flavor and they have it going on spot on. J also love the vibe and ambiance. Sound track puts anyone in a great mood. Thank you for a great experience.

iiYXQTAnZusodqVQIR_30g.text: An excellent burger shop in the heart of SoHo.  This American business traveler has suffered through far too many crappy burgers over his past few months in London.  Honest Burgers succeeds where others falter: they buy great quality beef, toppings & bun are of an equally high caliber, and they know how to fry both onion rings & potatoes (British friends: let's compromise and call them frites).Rosemary + potato is a match made in heaven.  Earthy/herbal flavors + salty/starchy = delicious.  And fried perfectly -- crisp, crunchy exterior with a creamy potato interior.  Onion rings were similarly impressive (see pic!).  Perfect texture, though the actual breading itself could use a bit more salt.Had the Honest Burger (when in Rome?) and was pleased to see it not overcooked.  Just the right amount of gooey cheddar coats the patty; onion relish and pickle cut the savory goodness with acid.  Nice and messy, mmmm.  I *hate* pickles but decided to leave these on for probably the first time ever.  It just worked.All in all, this is a place I'll definitely return to.  Can't say that about too many places I've visited so far, but that's three in SoHo now (others being Pizza Pilgrims & Gelupo.  Don't miss either of those!).  Nothing like a good burger & frites.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Ooey goodness
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Proper breading on an onion ring. All other places need to be taking notes.
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Honest burger and remnants of my order of onion rings

OPJOYpN7r_OjJqCKDUOZgQ.text: My sister and I went here after a long morning of walking and touring. We went because of the high recommendations on Yelp! They were right! Our server was enormously attentive and helpful. We started with the onion. Super crispy and flavorful! I got the Deli Burger- no cheese. It was juicy and cooked perfectly. My sister got the Honest Beef. The fries (chips) are incredible! They have been my favorite side dish throughout our entire trip to Europe. Definitely make sure you get the Rosemary fries! I also got an iced tea which was served in a mason jar and with a lemon. It's so good and you will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Onion rings! Crispy and amazing!
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Deli burger with a side of rosemary fries (chips) and iced tea!
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Iced tea with a lemon!

Ek4VMLAOlzi031yvVnwkBA.text: This place is honestly just alight. Honestly, it isn't anything special for sure. I honestly don't know if Europeans even know what a good burger tastes like. The only thing I can say with complete honesty is that this place is popular. In all honesty, I really think this place is mediocre. The meat was honestly dry, the waiter/service was honestly good and the environment is honestly packed. This 3 star rating is the most honest thing I have ever done in my life. After the meal, I overheard this honest conversation:English woman: Come on! Be honest am I fat?English man: Fine, honestly, you are fat.English woman: Wtf is wrong with you fu*ker! I fu*king hate you!

f3YhNameRxs6iHen3RtODA.text: word on the street is Honest Burgers do some of the best burgers in london, so I had to make it my mission to get down there and put these Chinese whispers to the test.The menu is split up by chicken/beef/vegetable plus they have specials which are written out on the blackboards adorning the walls. E and I both went for the Honest burger - patty with red onion relish, smoked bacon, mature cheddar, pickled cucumber and lettuce, which comes with signature rosemary fries. Washed down with ginger beer and homemade lemonade.....So the verdict - did the Honest live up to all the hype? Yes. Yes it did. It's not quite my best burger in London - that title is proudly held by the folks over at Patty & Bun but it's a very close second. the patty is nice and juicy and the bun is robust enough to stay together right until the last bite. the chips definitely get a special nod - plus its becoming increasingly rare for restaurants to include chips alongside the meal instead of charging you extra so that's alwaysa good thing.

AOkfegYZHNkaFs9KBE0y3w.text: ***update***A week after I posted this - Honest announced that their special was making a comeback. Nonetheless, thanks for bringing it back to my life. Too far?***Where do I start? I'm a big burger fan and can safely say that I have been too all the top burger joints over the last couple of years (and I keep going back). I have been to Honest around 15 times. Where does honest rank? Their beef, chorizo, manchego.... burger was the best I have EVER had. Not just in London. But ever. (Been to 40 countries around the world!)Their regular burgers and specials since are good but fall behind Patty & Bun in my honest opinion. Still lacks behind some burger places in America (except for that damn special!)Their fries will always top the London burger scene, rosemary fries. Fantastic. They also benefit from having a iPad waiting system, which competitors are lacking. This allows you to grab a drink elsewhere if the wait is long (and it will be). Definitely go!Ps. Can you bring the special back or offer it to me for one day?

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Burger/Rosemary fries/lemonade/onion rings.

Od_InJ4wlJFr2HO7wGDDmQ.text: This was stop #2 in our hipster burger tour in London, the first being Patty & Bun. We were happy to discover stop #2 was located around the corner from our Soho hotel, it made it really convenient to do takeaway and avoid the 45-60 min queue on a Wed eve.Honest Burger totally delivered with an outstanding burger but I'd  still have to give the edge to P&B.  I had the signature Honest burger made with a generous beef patty, bacon, cheese and all the standard trimmings.  It was tender and flavorful with each bite, just not as inventive as the Smoky Robinson at P&B.  My wife had their veggie burger and she testified that it was the best veggie burger she ever had, it "broke" her taste buds.  It was a composite veggie fritter patty topped off with a fresh cucumber yogurt sauce.  So if you fancy a veggie incarnation, this appears to be the spot.Onion rings were so-so and the chips/fries and chipotle mayo were good.  Service was polite and on point, solid experience all-around!

Bpe8we08cn8QWsRoYHlWDg.text: FYI, I am comparing Honest Burgers to burgers from the U.S. I don't have a lot of comparison for burgers in the UK.But overall, I wasn't impressed with my Honest Burger.It had only one strip of bacon, broken in half (so no bacon loaded burger here!).The burger itself was dry; I thought it would be moister, especially as I was told it would be 'pink in the middle' (so medium rare to medium).I asked for a fork (I was getting to go) and was given some strange, wooden utensil that I'm pretty sure would have given me mouth splinters.No go from me, wouldn't go back.

KtYIgyI_LuJ7fmnNQmEwrw.text: So maybe I've been spoiled by the awesome burgers I had on our last USA west coast trip. Maybe my expectations were set too high after reading all those great reviews on Yelp. Whatever the case, this was not a very memorable burger. The onion relish was a nice touch, and the bun was very tasty. However, as another reviewer commented, the flavor of the patty was quite bland and it wasn't very tender. The fries were fine. Service was friendly. Ambiance was OK but music just a tad too loud. Honestly, the best part of the meal for me was the gin special: a creative take on a gin & tonic. All in all, I felt the restaurant didn't live up to the hype and was quite pricey for what it offers.

BJyVQ0sI-yYJTHlmCukheQ.text: Honest Burgers is always busy! Expect to wait an hour or more for dinner. Their Soho location is pretty small so it makes sense since it's so popular. The menu is simple. There aren't a whole lot of options but I believe that it the point. They stick to a few things and they do it right. I've tried the Honest Burger and I also tried their special at the time which had jalapenos all up in it. Both burgers were pretty good and definitely filled me up. I wouldn't go as far as saying it's the best burger ever. It's not in my opinion. But they pride themselves on using great British produce. They use fresh quality ingredients and that's something I can appreciate. The burgers are reasonably priced and come with their delicious rosemary chips. Worth an hour wait? Maybe not. I suggest coming during lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Jalapeno Chorizo Burger

fqM8rjQcgKo9EEFHeohIhQ.text: I have to say, I was rather unimpressed by our visit to Honest Burgers after all the hype that I've heard. The standard for burgers in London is high, with local favorites like Patty & Bun, Byron, and GBK already contesting the American influx of chains like Five Guys and Shake Shack. I ordered The Honest and my main problems with it were: 1) The burger was not served hot. Lukewarm at best. 2) The patty was smaller than the bun and not juicy at all. It felt like it was equivalent to maybe 4 bites at most. 3) The bun was disappointing. I am used to brioche buns in London and this was not noteworthy at all. Felt like a mediocre bun that you could have picked up at a supermarket in America. 4) The rosemary chips they served us were tiny shards of potato that were more appropriate to eat with a spoon. Is this what they serve you after 9 pm? Their potato leftovers?And then finally, this is the only place in London that I can remember who gave me the bill before I asked for it. By that time it was 10 pm but the location isn't supposed to close until 11 pm so I thought that was very premature and unnecessary.

WRq3Ebk1gxOBeasqXt8fJA.text: The burgers were homemade and very juicy and delicious. The fries or "chips" were crispy and plentiful. Didn't care for the ginger beer too much, but my friend said the lemonade was awesome. Excellent service. A little hard to find since it's on a street originally designed for horse and buggy. Well worth a stop.

j0da6auT6L_JxPvwpU4HUA.text: We found that restaurant because of Yelp and we had some very delicious handmade burgers! At lunch time the restaurant got filled very fast and some guys had to wait outside. A good sign for the quality. The meat and all the stuff around was fresh! Go there for a meal if you like burgers!!!

m0uWSsJV2AZLWbIFD5iZrw.text: Was nervous as an American who's use to amazing burgers.  I can attest this place is really good.  Onion rings were amazing!

6F8517CF7LIOH6tltr4BTg.text: Being from Los Angeles, i have had some pretty great craft burgers. I came to honest burger after reading some yelp reviews about it and i have to say, for London, it was a pretty awesome burger. I got the honest burger, chip (fries) and their onion rings (which happen to be gluten-free). The fries were my favorite part but thats not to say the burger and onion rings weren't great as well. They also were offering a free beer with each burger ordered which i of course took advantage of and although the beer was pretty gross, it was free so i was perfectly happy drinking it.  The place is located in a pretty cute alley of soho, so if you're in the area, which i highly recommend going to, you should stop by and have a try (that rhymed).

q5vPeOXb9M--AGIrSsZoCQ.text: Honestly, Honest Burgers has the best burger. This was my favorite go to spot while staying in London. So bad for my waistline, but so good for my soul. The staff is always super friendly. My favorite location was the one near Liverpool. Very relaxed atmosphere and the staff was super friendly. I frequented the location so often it became my home away from home.

8zp4TUrfIb-NSWSaAgKmVA.text: Now where do I start? Perfectly cooked meat, with faultless selection of toppings. The burger wasn't too greasy which is a plus because most other burgers joints are so greasy that the burger and bun disintegrate within your fingers into a million pieces. To be 'Honest' the burger was great but the star was the chips that come as a side. They reminded me of a fish and chip shop where you can get the scraps if you ask nicely. Small, crispy and incredibly addictive with the added seasoning. Friendly/helpful staff as well. Top Marks all round! (Visit - 15/09/2014 Dinner)

zfkVEJCp28KKPCRJRKGcew.text: The perfect blend,meat on the right point with an spectacular flavor. The burger comes with a side of fries that are also amazing,seasoned to perfection. Friendly staff,and good serving time.

hArO1Rk-uZLfCf0Gb3AZwg.text: Nice interior, very friendly service and fantastic burgers. The "beef special" is like an taste explosion. You taste every single ingredient inside. To make a long story short: My recommendation for the best burgers in town

2BMUvJE_Bp7f5YWnZO_p8Q.text: You won't forget the chips that come with their burgers. It's absolutely tasty and different with normal chips. It's clear that they make it by themselves and use ginger and rosemary salt to season the chips. It will be the first thing you want to eat when the plate is served in front of you.The burger is unforgettable either. I had a medium beef cheeseburger with Red Leicester cheese and onions. The bun, cheese and patty melted together in my mouth, which felt amazing! Medium patty was definitely the highlight of my burger and you can even ask for a vegan bun too. I came here at around midday in a Tuesday and it did not take me long to get a table for five. It was a perfect sunny day, we were seating outside, enjoying our delicious burgers and chips with the accompany of iced lemonade. What could be better?

kU9fnAN4usf_652t9R11yw.text: I came here after my THIRD attempt at getting into Patty & Bun (seriously?!), which failed, obviously.Im really glad I did, my burger (I had the Honest Burger) was really good, and Mrs K really enjoyed her Veggie Burger (score!), and you get fries too included.Decently priced, and not a large wait in this case, though apparently this can be an issue.My new favourite burger place in London:)

YC_n_qgCArGupJb59Ejafg.text: Other than being a huge ramen fanatic, I am an equally huge burger fanatic. For some time now, since having tried the heavenly deliciousness of Tommy J's in Davis, California, USA, I have been on the hunt for a burger to topple the flavor from Tommy J's.While Honest Burgers isn't quite a Tommy J's, it definitely makes it to my list of London's top burger joints.Now, let's get real. There are fast food chain burgers that are frozen patties and meant to rely on sauce to give you flavor. Then there are REAL burger shops where the meat is seasoned properly to bring out both the natural flavors and the master seasoning. Honest Burgers falls into the latter category. My girlfriend and I ordered the Honest Burger (hey, you don't know a burger after your restaurant's name unless it's good, right?) medium-pink and two jars of their homemade lemonade. Lemonade? Tasty. The Honest Burger? Even tastier.The grill masters in the kitchen definitely know what they are doing when they are preparing and grilling these patties to make them so succulent and flavorful. If you're in the area, I would definitely recommend this burger stop for some tasty burgers.And if you're in Northern California, USA sometime... I highly recommend traveling to Davis, California and stopping by "Tommy J's" (inside a bar called Froggy's). The world's best burgers are still made there.Cheers

Big1p7pxq-RIyRLug41msw.text: Here I come to be the voice of dissension!Yeah so, I'd been wanting to try Honest Burgers for aaaaaaaaaaages.  It's regularly been declared one of the best burgers in London.  As finding a good burger is my personal grail quest, of course I wanted to try it.Man... I was so let down!  I got the Honest and subbed cheddar for stilton.  Where was that stilton?  I have no idea because I couldn't taste it.  And there is no sauce to speak of on the burger, so mayo had to be added.  But despite the addition of the mayo, and despite the fact that my burger was a pleasant pink color, it was quite possibly the driest burger I've had since moving to London.  Seriously dry.  Bizarrely so.That being said.  The chips are fantastic.  Probably in the top 3 of chips, and for a person who isn't the biggest fan of rosemary, that's a lot coming from me.We sat outside, so service was nonexistent.  We had to fetch the bill ourselves, and I noticed that of the three tables outside, one other table had to do the same, so not a great batting average.  I find the menu extremely limited as well.  If you're only going to offer three burgers, you better make sure they're done extremely well.Maybe I just had a fluke experience, but sadly, I don't see myself coming back.

drZZsQk5nrTCzorGBZ6LUw.text: Just had the current special which is called The Louisiana Burger. Its a Blackened Cajun Beef Patty, Bloody Mary Ketchup, Fried Onions with Beef Tomato and Blood Leaf. As I type this I believe its the best Burger I have tasted. There are a few places in London that guarantee amazing Burgers but this particular burger just blew me away. Therefore I have dubbed it The Burger of Brobdingnagian!The Burger costs £10 and comes with Rosemary Chips which are also ridiculously tasty. Throw in a bottle of Budvar and you have a great meal for £13.50.   Do it!

jR9iRZ9L0vQpmEs35YbgnA.text: Good burgers, it tasted different because it has rosemary herbs but the meat was overcooked and dry. The quality of service is very good the place is nice

1O4erSRdo4RoQigurtsBTw.text: It is the best burger I ever have. I have eaten burgers all my life and in different cities around the world, the secret is the combination of ingredients and the sauces. Nothing pretentious just the perfect mix. I had the honest burger with chipotle sauce on the side and Rosemary fries. I also tried the bacon ketchup, just superb.

nYHJLJMFAgoNFUe3HhRz0A.text: One of the best burgers in London and served with some great rosemary fries. I have always experienced a very smiling staff although the place is crowded very often.

SwDEfWrXeKFf5tKll6UWRw.text: My friend, who is mainly a vegetarian said that the burger she had here proabably ranked in her top 3 of all-time burgers. I have to agree.I like the simplicity and efficiency of this place. I am always a fan of restaurants etc that have a limited menu. You know that the food has to be somewhat fresh..The food here is outstanding. Service was quick and friendly.

iPCsPCE3u9ZEMzIYVIy-Ag.text: My sister once confessed to me that she ate homemade burgers everyday for two weeks...for breakfast.With that in mind I asked her to take me to her favourite burger joint. She took me to Honest Burgers. She had hyped it up A LOT. I was expecting great things. I took her recommendation in ordering the Honest burger, while she opted for the vegetarian fritter burger. I was curious why my burger monster of a sis would opt for the veggie option, but turned out she's had everything on the menu at least twice and was having a non-meat day.The Honest burger at £9 (fries included!) was the most flavoursome burger I've eaten since I had the one at Goodman last year (and their burger is pretty damn good). The fries with rosemary salt is out of this world, and to top it all off I could eat my meal with an ice cold fresh ginger beer in hand! For real this is my top combo.Anyway, that soft warmed bun, the onion relish and the smoked bacon and mature cheddar hit my tastebuds to deliver a perfect mouthful of burger with every bite. No extra sauce needed or falling apart burger bun. Even my sis couldn't resist and ended up taking a bite out of my burger. So much for non-meat day. It was Sunday she commented...Meat-free Monday is tomorrow.

jcGHrWqUOID-n0agT-7nmg.text: Meh... That's how we felt when we rolled in Honest Burger last night and took a seat. My companion immediately said 'those burgers look really small'. And he was right, these are not your behemoth Byron burgers but very medium sized and managable, I didn't have to unbutton my pants or anything after. I've passed by the HB in Brixton and thought it looked very hip in design, this branch looks decidedly IKEA and middle class. Lots of pine furniture. Not so middle class though when they plonked ketchup and Hellmans' mayo in a plastic bottle on the table. My Diet Coke came still in the can. Uhh, no glass?  Listen, you can't be middle class in price* and style and then ghetto burger bar in other ways. Be consistent. Those cocktails that come in mason jars trend was fully in place though. We upped our 'meh' to an 'hmmm' when the food arrived. Initially the rosemary chips blew me away, they were fabulous. But the more you eat, the more heavily salted and seasoned they start to feel in your mouth. The burger was quite good. I'd defintely go back again for one. And £8 price tag was a totally reasonable meal. I'd be happier if they offered starters too, I do like to feel like a glutton leaving these places. * £11.50 for the special burger! What a jump in the price tag!

6zQSeYIrL7rjtWFJsBMg9A.text: Maybe the best burger I've ever had. The tribute burger is absolutely delicious and the rosemary fries are just the icing on the cake.

23W-8RZONUXDe35N4NR1eg.text: The Honest Burgers menu is pretty simple - choice of three burgers: Beef, Chicken or vegetable. Each burger also comes with rosemary salted chips.Honest Burger (£10.50) - contains beef, red onion relish, smoked bacon, mature cheddar, pickled cucumber, lettuce. A truly simple burger with strong bold flavours. The beef patty itself had a crisp outer layer giving the whole burger a nice smokey flavour and the red onion relish had a sweet caramel taste.Tribute Burger (£10.50) - beef, bacon, American cheese, burger sauce, French mustard, pickles, onion and lettuce. Bit of a mouthful to describe this burger, but all the different flavours worked perfectly together! Special Burger (£12.50) - so special it even has it's own menu plaque! This consisted of Cajun beef, smoked bacon, fried onions, American cheese, smoked ketchup, pickles. Smokey is definitely a word to describe this awesome burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

ynL_L2EbmjpUiaBAHrSAdA.text: This place gets high marks for value-for-money. The burgers include a generous portion of rosemary chips for under 10 pounds. However, I'm not a huge fan of the burgers themselves. The onion relish is painfully sweet. Not the kind of sweetness that you can get from caramelizing onions, but rather the kind you get from adding a ton of sugar. It ruins what is otherwise a decent, but not great burger. The meat is in a nice thick patty, but not nearly the flavor of Shake Shake.I've had problems with incorrect orders and then when it was fixed the plate came out with the original portion of chips, now stone cold. It was corrected eventually, but frustrating nonetheless.

DrzQDEBA4oUhe_DZLci-ow.text: This place was great. Bathrooms could be a little cleaner but overall everything else was great. I'm not a burger person but it was amazing.

cxfo0tZ6MjjZ-QJTpsUj7w.text: Quick review:+ great burgers+ friendly staff+ local ale (bottled) and cocktail selection+ gluten free buns available- small venueFull review:I visited Honest Burgers on Saturday lunch time. We got there at the perfect time and didn't have to wait for a table for four, but noticed as we were leaving that a long queue has formed, so arrive early!The menu is simple. Order a burger and it comes with rosemary-flavoured chips. Beef burger is the star, although there are chicken and veggie varieties, plus gluten-free buns too. You can configure your burgers as you like it (medium rare? Extra patties? Curry sauce? No problem!)There's also a good selection of drinks, including local ale (bottled) and cocktails to wash down the burgers and chips. Great spot for quickly refuelling if you are nearby.

2LtiElarVGDrfjsYO4i14w.text: Honestly one of the best burger I could eat so far! :) Delicious meat, tasty buns, perfectly baked rosemary fries (definitely the "petit plus"), original drinks and friendly staff: sounds like this formula works as there is always people waiting for the next available table at Honest. They also play the "organic" and "hipster atmosphere" cards, which makes you even happier to eat there.Last good point: prices! Even for being in the middle of London (that is clearly not the cheapest town around) prices are really reasonable, as you can count your burger/fries/drink for less than 15£.Looking forward to my next London trip, be sure I'll pass by Honest!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Could die for this one!

_7ZlX-fjRfdu9VvyBBJd5w.text: DE LI CIOUSSSSS!Let's just begin with their chips. They have one of the best chips. Rosemary salted chips? Halleluja. And can we get a shout out for their gluten free burger buns! Plus they are yum! Well priced and delicious burgers. Oh, and a side of bloody mary? or other alcoholic beverages? Of course I'm in. Do come early though as they don't take reservations. Expect a wait in the evenings especially on the weekends-- duh!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Bloody Mary and gin drink

tkXL8GpcB4BfCKcS0QYdyA.text: Our Air B&B host in Piccadilly sheepishly recommended a burger place to us saying "maybe you Americans eat burgers all the time already."  "Not true, only for breakfast and lunch" I responded.  And he pointed us up the way to here. Ok, so we arrive and there's a bit of a wait but the dude at the front is very friendly and very patient with the 4 of us.   After a reasonably short wait we are seated and the 5th member of our party shows up.  So, there are a few drinks here (mostly craft beer and a few gin things) and burgers.  Simple ya?  Everyone orders something kinda fancy, I just got a cheeseburger with fries and a side of curry.  I asked for mustard and we got the choice of english or american, I asked for both. The friendly waitress was more than happy to oblige.Now listen up. This was an amazing burger.  Really.  Through and through, end to end.  The burger and the fries was perfection.  I've had many a burger (I'm american remember?)...Shakeshack, In-n-out, Umami Burger...name it.  Here the burger is a thicker patty so there's not a direct comparison to the folk making thin burgers...but all in all it was just amazing and perfect in size and ratio and flavor. Done.  Combined with the super friendly staff and I'd say its a perfect place to be eating.

Hj24dgo1TSZgolW5baJWaQ.text: Great place to have a burger in London. We loved it. If you prefer your burgers to be cooked well make sure to let them know. All burgers are served pretty rare but that is their style. Fantastic place.

t3NqLb4TRJmVvOK5tQp_eg.text: Ah, Honest Burgers, how I love you, let me count the ways:1. several awesome meat choices2. availability of gluten-free buns that don't taste like cardboard nor have the texture of plaster; soft and pillowy loveliness!3. rosemary fries, a stroke of simple brilliance4. non-junky refreshing drinks 5. super-friendly and helpful personnel!I'm a girl of simple tastes. I don't need pretentious stuff arranged in the shape of a tiny flower on a large white plate. I don't need amouse-bouches. I do need simple, delicious food made with good-quality ingredients -- and on that, Honest Burgers, you certainly delivered!Now I have one more reason to come to London!

e-zKl7_7tey0EDvzdiQziw.text: I'd say if you're looking for a good burger, Honest Burgers is a failsafe option. Now, on the other hand, if you're a burger-obsessed fiend with crazy high standards on this comfort-food favourite, I'd still say it's fine, but you may be ever so slightly underwhelmed if you've come here based on the general hype that these are "the best burgers ever". I don't really have much to say about this place other than that the food was good, the prices were fair, there was a good selection of burgers on the menu catering to all food eaters, our waitress was lovely and considering how busy it is, you don't have to wait too long for your food (if you don't count the waiting time to queue to get in that is!) My only criticism is that if you're a gin lover and happen to order one of the gin-based drinks, don't get your hopes up too much, they're fairly average-tasting.

Q_0t6Zf3bLI9eKGSz2tfMw.text: I had the fritter with fries and onion rings. Service was excellent and the food was fantastic. The rings had a nice curry flavor that went well with the coriander in the burger. Perfection.

Mx_FtdxbdAdos_BUW0QuJg.text: Literally the best beef burger I ever had!!! Service is also good. Anybody who passes by should have a try. Won't disappoint you.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

oGMlFfpiJ-JFH8JV_m6Wow.text: Cute little place. Food was good. The applejuice was sour. They changed it for me to lemonade, but it was made with carbonated water which was also weird. Overall a good experience.

uJw1_OrRSMw7zuiglwa4uQ.text: One of the best places I went to while in London. Honest. :-) Yes, amidst all of London's cosmopolitan flavors, a burger joint was one of the best places. They did it right. Also, get the Cole slaw. It's great.

VKhJYmMHJ9SziEB6L3nmxg.text: Awesome succulent juicy burgers + Craft beers + friendly service =  a winning combination!If you're in the area and hungry... just do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The 'Honest' Burger - dee-ee-lish!

-8KK3myOcHokbRrmGlqq_A.text: great burger joint in soho i was delighted to find on a very busy day of touristing around the city.wonderful decor and great music (not too loud) playing.  friendly staff and reasonable prices.i got an honest burger with rosemary fries, it arrived quickly and it was absolutely delicious.  the fries were unique and the burger was bursting with flavour.  I highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. glorious

MkJT8HZL08dDcuROwlRt-Q.text: Really solid burgers. What made this place a stand out was how gluten friendly they were. Everything on the menu is gluten free (including the onion rings). The only things that have gluten are the buns (packed separately) and beer. This location is also super close to theaters for a pre theater dinner.

0BWhKLHDaPZWTB73Zw2d9w.text: Excellent burger. I'm from Chicago, so I usually see bigger portions however. So that was my only complaint. I was hungry from walking all day and the burger and fries was like an appetizer! I'm 5'9" and 165lbs. And I'm not a heavy eater. Excellent place though in a cool little location. Definitely recommend.

42bHK8kz_pzU4SvTgThKVg.text: YUM. Probably the best burger I've ever had. Chips are a bit funky as I don't like rosemary, but other than that the food and drinks were flawless.Would have been 5* if it wasn't for the long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails

lssUVAdfNvJpJsR-pAqQtg.text: Brilliant burger!  As an American and avid burger lover I have found that often when traveling most burgers miss the mark...not so much here at Honest.  We happened upon this lovely place while heading back to the tube, I'm glad we decided to stop in!  Great beer selection, lovely little place, with amazingly attentive service, and equally amazing burgers!  Special for me (avocado burger, seriously who in their right mind passes up tomato and avocado on a burger)!?!?  Drink: Kentucky Tea Sour.

8Fc_tXJpnuHh5nyF_vB1YQ.text: OK here's the deal! Me and some work mates have a thing we like to call "Burger Wednesdays". Basically every wednesday we pick a local burger joint and chow down for lunch. Our trip has taken us to many a burger joint around the Soho/Oxford street area. The latest joint was Honest Burgers in Soho. The menu is small but easy which clearly helped the chef as out orders arrived very quickly. I ordered the Honest burger and honestly it was great! The meat was cooked perfectly and full of flavour and best of all the fries come WITH the burger instead of having to order them separately. This automatically gives Honest an extra point in my book. The best thing about this place was that when we were finished we walked back to the office and all commented on how comfortable we felt i.e we weren't stuffed to bursting point which is usually the case on Burger Wednesday. This wasn't down to the portions as they were very good. I think it was just because it was such a clean and well cooked burger. I for one am really happy that so many great burger places are now dotted throughout London town and Honest is easily up there with the best!

cQYnsxkkp9zug99HBbTReg.text: Finally went to checkout one of the most raved burger joint in London! Opps almost there but not just yet! We were told by a very friendly host that its going to be an hour and forty-five mins for a table for two. Hmmmm. We were almost discouraged but we toughed it out. We really want to try HB. So we left our number and ran an errand to kill sometime. Thankfully by the time we returned to HB we got seated almost immediately. The process of ordering was quick as they have straight-forward menu. I had the cheese burger while my husband had the HB. In just few minutes our order arrived. Ohhhh looks good! The burger did look a tad small but my husband and I thought it was just adequate. The meat patty was juicy and the other ingredients that came with it tasted pretty satisfactory together. However, I cant help myself from comparing it to my favorite burger (in-n-out)--the special sauce. It would have been perfect if that sauce was added to it. On the other hand, my husband and I were impressed of the crispy rosemary chips (fries) that came with it. It was really delicious. We will definitely come back here.

kLWhgtuwyiCz_IV2ffuU4g.text: I really liked this place. The atmosphere is fun and the lemonade is great. We tried the honest burger, a plain beef burger, and a chicken burger. All were great. We were satisfied. It's a little hard to get a table (a bit of a wait), but they will try and seat you as soon as they can. Tables turn over fast.

pHynPjeoYdKe5e4LSG4bLA.text: Amazing burgers, pink in the middle. Rosemary chips couln't get any better! Love for the first taste!

Mv9h2VZ1-3BqCvheskAiUw.text: I came here before, but the line and the wait were too long, so we went elsewhere. On Monday night, with little wait, got in. This place is small with two tables outside, one for four, the other for two. Inside, window seating is a counter with three seats and then about a dozen tables inside. It was controlled chaos and managed to get in just before another lined formed outside. The selection is limited, but with a burger that good there really doesn't have to be any more on the menu. The Honest burger should be the only choice. Just a really great burger. Fries were nicely seasoned and a fair drink selection. Five stars if we did not have to wait so long to place an order and to get the bill. One person handled all of that and with his head to the ground, there was little chance to get his attention. He made it busier than it had to be. Any with the noisy group of birthday people, it was almost to the point of obnoxious. Get rid of those two, and this is easily five stars.

0-Vl5gaHCbcoN0gznhWQ3w.text: I've been wanting to try Honest Burgers for ages but could never bring myself to venture out to Brixton (it will happen one day!!) so I was excited to hear that the Soho restaurant opened. The place is small, so there was a bit of a wait (but expected since it was prime dinner time on a Friday night). Worth the wait! The burger was delicious - simple, no frills and accompanied with yummy rosemary fries. My only small gripe was that we were a table of about 7 and they forgot an order, a bit unfortunate, but the waitress was extremely apologetic, notified the kitchen immediately and took it off our bill. Not used to seeing that kind of service in London! Would definitely come back when the burger craving hits.

2Nv5cGls1stXNoPg9ORFKA.text: I was wanting to try Honest Burgers for a long time and I finally did. Burgers are great, I got the cheese burger and it was really really good. One of the few places that when you order medium rare, they serve you exactly that. The bun was great too. Chips are amazing (much better than other 'premium' burgers chains) and best of all, included in the price, which is really good too! Place is a bit too small and is always busy, so maybe that's the only drawback. However, loved it and will come back (hopefully very soon).

pAjI8f_ML8q7BclVXkCRXQ.text: This is one of the best burgers that I have ever had (and being an American, I have had some pretty good burgers!) All the ingredients were high quality.  Just the right amount of messiness (some places the burgers are so goopy and messy it is just gross).  Really tasty, would highly recommend!  Long wait on the weekends, so get your name in early!

V5GvlWdrbyS3CaEbrrg79A.text: Outstanding and Gluten Free. Found this gem of a little restaurant on vacation with my family this summer. Honest Burgers served up the tastiest burgers and fries ("chips") and they were all gluten free. Make sure you tell your server that you need GF as there are items that are not GF on the menu. We we so happy with our meals that we ate there twice in the week we were there!

Ti-mxsHFr5eC573mo5UMRw.text: Pretty impressed with this joint! I'll take my veggie burgers any place I can get them, but it's always fun to go places that are known for being awesome.  The serving was huge and came with fries included (nice touch). They were a little dry for my taste but that might be because I got a takeaway. Place was cute and super busy - will have to come back for an eat-in experience :)

sk7l5MQntxHbVh8v3aYoVw.text: Great burger! It might look a bit small at the beginning but it is fresh,  soft and very tasty! We tried the honest meat burger and we really enjoyed both the burger and the fries! Nice central location in Soho, with a "hip" atmosphere. Don't be discouraged by this, the food is great.

JHTTIciMr52E7lQn7kFxKA.text: i really liked this hamburger cos' were so yummy!!!

0XV8C-XeGwx0-XyTA1AKzA.text: Best American style beef burger in London, and I'm glad it's just around the corner from my flat! It's as good as In and Out. Price is what you pay for good quality. Always order the specials, like the Double Double.

NL3DR0OmqEG8Qs_FUvjfXw.text: High quality burger with exceptional crispy French fries that are garnished with rosemary salt.

lyQ8FwED4oERv2RYlXknfQ.text: Excellent choice whilst visiting London! I am a COELIAC and usually i find it difficult to get any gluten free burgers!!!!! & gluten free beer!!!!! AMAZING i hope ye open in Dublin !!!!

dhsA-KV-CiWozAfY8NzWag.text: The new Soho outpost of Honest Burgers brings that hipster vibe into town. The Brixton Village original is still better for atmosphere but is teeny tiny and inconvenient for anyone central. Same menu and same excellent flavoursome burgers. Still prefer burgers at Hache on balance but would recommend Honest Burgers unreservedly. Come during off peak times and avoid the queue.

zzqjS50Xk9hEkj6M2WWgsA.text: The last time I was in London was when I was a teen and the only hamburgers then were called The Wimpy Burger which were sadly tiny, greasy imitations of a hamburger. I was delighted upon my return this week that The Honest Burger was here. My daughter and I had initially chosen this chain store as she has celiac disease and needed a gluten free bun.  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  The hamburger was least 50% smaller than the standard American hamburger.  However, the beef was of high quality and the well cooked seated outside of the meat added to the inner medium cooked level.  The fries were seasoned with rosemary which is never used on American hamburgers but was again a very nice difference.  We found the food and the staff delightful.  Good value. Viva the differences in hamburgers.  Recommend this restaurant for tourists and locals and for those wanting a hamburger with a gluten free bun.

NuDeXi3NU7uPG17LsJ909w.text: loved honest burger. the restaurant is pretty small so if you come at lunch time rush expect a queue but the food is great  especially the rosemary chips! A great place to go for a quick lunch with a friend.

a8Z_y18mBLuNgitvZke2qA.text: After many tries for the Brixton branch, I finally tried the Soho branch. Lets be honest here the main star at honest burger is not the burger but the rosemary chip. The burger here is average at the least, the best part of the burger is not the meat not the bun but the onion jam! the meat was very over seasoned in the bad way!

-v-5yV1LIRLAomc4mv32pA.text: Best burger I have had in London. I much prefer burgers in New York than in London; however Honest Burger comes very close to some of my favorite burger joints in New York. Definitely visit Honest Burger as opposed to other places like MeatLiqor or Lucky Chip

k5OqgaQJskuvMRe9767qVg.text: I think everyone has said it. Burgers are good enough, service is pretty lackluster to hit or miss. I can generally get over that - they do get busy at times in the evening and there's only a couple of them serving. However, the one think that really gets trying is a particular American practice of dropping of the bill before anyone has asked for it. Just find it a bit kinda 'your done, get out' and this is kinda honest burgers approach. It kinda put a damperner on the visit and considering that we were on our third round of drinks and looking to order another round of food, which is good, they could do with sorting out that part of the business.

3dQjxyKG1pN6jsHchsj1PQ.text: I read about Honest Burgers in an article highlighting the best burgers in London and how they differed from burgers in NY. What's the difference? Burgers in London are known to be simple, just your beef patty, lettuce, tomato, and bacon so that the quality of beef is highlighted, while NY burgers are known for speciality toppings and sauces. Honest Burgers is exactly the epitome of what London burgers are acclaimed to be. The patty wasn't seasoned, which you would assume would be bland, but it was actually the opposite. The burger was so flavorful and dripping in its juices. You were able to taste the pure beefiness. Add the perfectly seasoned Rosemary fries and you have a complete meal! Also, another thing to note about the burgers in London - you don't feel guilty and weighed down while devouring it and after you finished your meal. It's a win -win situation in my books!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

vPhFo5zLGI0Yeho6m1DPnQ.text: Super good place a great service! French fries are so good. Wings were good burger amazing!

CbPa5-juScXFkATuzCmL4Q.text: Let me just start by saying AMAZING burger and chips (chips aka "french fries" "fries").  I was walking through SOHO London and I saw this on Yelp! and I really wanted to try this place out out. So it's my last day here I walk in and I see theres 3 types of burgers you can get. Chicken / Beef / Vegetables.  You know im a little T-Rex so I had to go with the beef. It comes with beef, red onion, smoked bacon, matured cheddar, pickled cucumber and lettuce. Your order automatically comes with a side of rosemary chips. Its actually huge as I could not finish all my chips.The burger was fantastic, big juicy patty it looked to be 1/4 - 1/2 lb. They cook it how you want so I asked for medium. All the ingredients in the burger are so tasty the fat pieces of bacon, the pickled cucumber, cheddar, red onion, gives it an amazing savory / delicious / a tiny hint of sweetness taste as you eat this.  After taking my first bite you know when you just shake your head like yeah this is good this is good this is really good.. and you don't say a word and continue to demolish your meal, thats what this was.The rosemary chips were a perfect compliment to the meal and it was delicious!Also look how they put the straw in my coke can, they bent the opening tab thing forward instead of how we usually put it towards the back and stuck my straw through there.  These English people.. they're on to something mate....!
