x3aHQb9f7kqCuBT_JRRoDw.text: GREAT burgers. vegan and gluten free options available which is always  a plus. Nice atmosphere with kind and accommodating staff.

BhvLbw0_PaQrK9yQfDYqww.text: Probably the best burger I've had in England.  Competes with Byron, Shake Shack and Five Guys but is a league higher.  The main difference is the quality of the meat, it is a real steak burger. They also default to medium (on the medium rare side), which I rarely get in the UK.  It was the perfect burger.  I had the Honest Burger, which included cheese, a nice onion relish, bacon (not overpowering), pickles and lettuce (which I didn't notice, but that is a plus).  Also includes rosemary chips (fries for my American friends), which were crispy and had a nice distinctive rosemary taste.  I was a little disappointed in the onion rings, they just did not have much flavor.  The burger, though, earns five stars on its own.

7eD_Ln2Aw6brmgKZyJgb2A.text: Busy and small enclosure, expect it to be crowded.  The atmosphere is great and noisy, probably not the best for a family dinner. All the staff had smiles on and approachable.  Burgers were yummy and hit the spot for a great dinning experience.

Ka43NKYbkLcclqZme7HFHQ.text: Honest burgers is better than honest.The meat is delicious, the fries are crispy, the terrace on a sunny day is lovely ! The staff is super nice and of very good advise. Try their Hawaiian beer, it has a passion fruit twist which is to die for !Best burger in London so far !

Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Chicken burger, cheese burger and rosemary fries.

CErxPFqFMJumBPgKx0TP9g.text: It may look like a regular slab of junk food, complete with token Stars and Stripes Flag poking out of the top, but this bad boy is anything but re-constituted junk. The restaurant uses rare breed aged beef sourced from the cream of the bovine crop, Ginger Pig Farm, and you can tell. Holy cow, it's good.

tgY_cENsLun4kIZ_TkKB2g.text: Great burgers and fries. I am still looking for the Aloha beer I ordered in stores, as it was one of the best I've ever had.

6szZSsJ6c8nHwl8HnQk8xQ.text: My wife and I were looking for an upscale burger joint and randomly stumbled upon Honest Burger. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meal. If you are ever in London and need a quick & quality meal (burger) this is your place! Friendly staff, small location so seating is limited, but we didn't wait long for a table.

4XC45FPvL_u4P_QDZj3b2g.text: Yay for gluten free options! The buns, the fried, even the onion rings,Oh my!First time coming here so I figured I'd go for the signature burger 'honest' and it was cooked to a perfect medium rare.The fries were probably one of my favorite so far. We also got the onion rings and honestly.. I could go without the pool of grease they came with.. They also had thyme in the coating which was surprising. Another surprise was the bubbly lemonade, didn't expect that :)Overall amazing service and delicious food with gluten free options!

wftt4R1oVX6Yhsw4ac_93g.text: I love Honest Burger. Even though it's a chain now, it's a pretty fantastic chain. The Honest Burger is a burger done to perfection, with rosemary chips and just a bit of condiments. I love a good burger, honestly, and this is honestly a good burger. Honest! Is it's the best burger ever? No, sadly, but it's still pretty damn good. The beer selection could be improved, but if you're here for just the beer you're making a huge mistake. Get the honest burger. Get some chips. Especially for the price, it's pretty amazing.

Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. An honest burger, chips, and a beer. How life should be led.

PM8rK05y8I8HIGeRHzWnGw.text: The best burger I've ever had in my life. Oktoberfest burger with an Oktoberfest beer and it was to die for. There will be a wait, but it's worth it.

U40fZXRt_JCp4nSl6YTNGw.text: Great burgers and fries at pretty good prices. Definitely stop here every time we are in London

hSUWMGoUKEkiwEfp_Bw1Sw.text: Honestly good!!! Loved the juicy patty and nice bun to go along with it. :) Rosemary fries come with the burger too!! nom nom!!A must go.

p8Kxcmu25Z9PbqacTDojsQ.text: THE SINGLE BEST VEGGIE BURGER I HAVE EVER HADNo joke.  I love a burger, but between fish and chips and all the burger joints the group of students I was with wanted to dine at, I absolutely HAD to get some veggies!  Enter Honest Burgers.  This is a chain.  A very, very good chain.  This location is tiny, but cozy and warm and welcoming.  I ordered this rocking veggie burger -- more like a veggie fritter and it was amazing.  Coincidentally served with an equally amazing yogurt-based sauce that was a little cool to the little bit of spice in the fritter.  It was the perfect pairing.  I would be willing to place a bet on the high quality of the beef burgers served here based solely on the attention paid to the non-beef eaters choosing to eat at a place with meat in the title if that makes sense.  Vegetarians would naturally not be drawn to a place called Honest BURGERS is what I'm getting at here, so why would a burger restaurant take so much care with a veggie burger?  Because they actually CARE and if they actually care, then all of their products are going to be delicious because that love goes into the quality and preparation of the food which makes it all taste that much better.  Oh, and try the honest signature cocktail for something new and refreshing.

AoXLykG5SzcwMLMMGMh3Pw.text: I've read a lot about honest and because I am a big burger fan I decided to go there and check it out.We went there by 8 pm (four people) and had to wait about 20 minutes (it's easier to get a table with only few people). The waitresses were really nice and friendly and we got onion rings for free because of the long wait.Ambience is great and I felt really comfortable. Everything is set up really nice so there is nothing to argue about. Food is great as well! I've never eaten Rosemary chips before but they are really delicious as well as the burger itself. Size and taste of the burger ( I had the Honest Burger) were great and nobody was worried because of the waiting.The guys are really friendly and I'll definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Honest Burger and Lemonade

pcSCHwOg_a1C48bJ7VlSog.text: Fantastic restaurant! They were so accommodating for my boyfriend's gluten and dairy allergies. The staff was communicative and kind. I had the Christmas special burger and a cider and it was fantastic! Great place for people with or without food allergies.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Here is the ingredients to that great burger :)
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. My Christmas burger with rosemary salted fries. They have gluten free buns as well!

zxKioAK0YMcql42eYT0yYw.text: Heard really good things about Honest Burger but for me it just tasted like every other mid range burger. They must be something right though with all the new chains they've opened up! The tribute burger I got was juicy. So juicy that my hands smelt of burger juice the whole night. But for me the flavours and textures were not there. The best burger I've tasted is Sketch's beef foie gras burger which doesn't have the standard mince beef texture and so really I probably just don't like burgers and probably shouldn't really be writing burger reviews.

-PMsq3bPiowHOu-HEta0tA.text: This place was delicious! I ordered the honest burger and it came with fries. It was cooked a perfect medium and was super juicy. I cant remember if the meat was organic, but I'm going to pretend it was. Service was excellent and we didn't have to wait long for a table. This was a great first meal in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

v4iRkKguYRQ96HEAvnZMkg.text: This place does burgers honestly - essentially just burgers and chips, done well, no fuss.  And you can tell they are doing something right as this tiny place gets very busy!  Eating awkwardly early is your best bet.  My boyfriend and I got a table for 2 on a Friday at 6 pm with no wait, but almost immediately after we arrived they filled up and a queue formed outside.  Lucky us!So basically you can have a chicken burger, a veggie burger, or a beef burger.  The beef burgers comes in a variety of options, whereas the other two do not.  If you go beef, you can get a cheeseburger, a bacon cheese burger, a plain burger, a "Special," and maybe one other incarnation.  Limited options, with a clear focus on good ingredients and good cooking without hiding behind any tricks.  I got the cheese burger - boyfriend got the Honest which is the same thing plus bacon.  They're cooked medium by default but I asked for medium-rare - it still seemed medium to me after my first bite but that's okay, since it was very juicy!  The red onion relish is bloody fantastic - adds almost a sweetness to the burger.  Fantastic.  The burger itself is quite easily finished, unlike in America where the portions are totally insane, you could actually eat this all yourself.  I couldn't stop eating the rosemary chips as well - I probably ruined them with ketchup but I think that improved them!Very good price at £8.50 for dinner.  It's a tight squeeze next to other tables, and bottles of beer will run you about £4-5.  If we can manage to get a table, I know we'd love to come back and have another burger anytime.

ZXJArvIKt_EPvGqSE5ffsg.text: A little expensive, but if you want a good burger I couldn't recommend anywhere else.  There's plenty to choose from (and vegetarian options), beer, and the onion rings are delicious. It depends on when you go, but I'd expect a wait.

vSSkX7B4X8-uJIDv7iT_lw.text: The best fries ever! The burgers are also amazing, staff are usually really friendly and laid back. The only set back is they don't do bookings so usually you have to queue for a while. But recently they started messaging you when your table is available so you could be in a pub near by having a drink while waiting..

YLpIoN1hYbYbyFFEDgRk0g.text: Loved it.  Got the Honest Burger, which comes with bacon and mature cheddar.  The burger was delicious and juicy, and the bacon was flavorful and not too crispy.  The red onion relish is made with slow cooked onions, which was fantastic.

HhUZVGveDUrML5EuUWCJtw.text: Hands down the best burger I have EVER had. I'm actually kind of disappointed because that means its about a 10 hour flight to ever eat something so delicious. Their rosemary chips are just amazing and their beverages are good too. The staff was so friendly and fun. It took a while to get our drinks but it was pretty busy so I didn't mind. I will definitely make it a point to go to Honest Burgers now every time I am in London.

8kCaymwi-YPv5rt7GHjavQ.text: One of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. Very friendly prices, too. The restaurant is tucked away in the quiet Meard Street in Soho, which is great. The only downside is that there tend to be queues in the evening.

RI82ihzdt7Sb-5PFP04mdg.text: Good burgers and a nice place, though a bit small and crowded in the evening. Honest Ale is solid.

ut6tabnlyfnDZOBbFfdlZA.text: What a super find  a friend suggested this new burger restaurant and having never been to their sister branch in Brixton we didn't know what to expect.The decor is tidy but relatively basic  wooden tables and chairs  but very nicely decorated- high ceilings and some quirky items on the wall such as a pair of horns.The welcome was very friendly and relaxed and I'd say the service was exemplary  really, whatever they give the staff here to keep them friendly and motivated should be bottled and sold.The burgers  which after all are the main event  were superb!I shared a chicken burger and a beef burger with my friend  she found them both a bit over seasoned and too salty  and I agreed with her about the beef burger but the chicken was fine for my taste.We were in a bit of a hurry and the waiter was more than happy to swap the burgers for less seasoned ones but we didn't have time.That is literally the only negative thing I have to say about Honest Burgers, which is why they get 5 stars.The chips were tasty and a welcome change from the standard anemic faire  with sea salt and rosemary.The chicken burger is a large piece of freshly grilled free range chicken  they keep it in brine before cooking  the result is a very tasty, moist and succulent burger. The buns are jut perfect  the right consistency. The beef burger was one of the best I've had. Same bun  and just the right balance of moist medium rare meet  with a well grilled exterior.We also tried their coleslaw which was delicious with added dill.I only had tap water but the table next door had home made lemonade served in jars, which looked fun (yes, I need to get out more).Although I didn't have room  the veggie burger looks amazing  it's cauliflower sweetcorn courgette fritter in a bun  with all kinds of delicious sounding salad things.The bill is presented in a retro tin box, which is also a fun and quirky touch.If you can deal with all the model types and uber trendy Soho crowd that come here  you are in for a treat.Prices I'd say are average or reasonable  £8.50 for the chicken or £7.50 for the beef  both include a choice of fries or coleslaw. I will definitely be back and not least because of the tasty food, good value and superb service.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

4XZMUdZazM0m-WDxIULUkw.text: So far, best burger in London. I've been on a burger binge for the last few months, I've tried a hell of a lot, this is a clear winner for me. They may not do as many sides as other burger bars, but the meat n rosemary fries are all you need!Also gluten free buns available!

GXciplHwKBS8vlsB11tiNQ.text: The quality of the pattie is second to none. However, it could do with being a little larger. Having said that the value for money is pretty good. I appreciate the fact that the chips are included in the price and they're very tasty. Honest burgers is one of the best in London and well worth a visit.

rhdgvOLGVIRNfaxt4cwsCQ.text: Well worth the wait! Fantastic burgers,  fantastic fries, and great salad. All around wonderful, fresh flavors, and the staff was rockin'.

CPv8bs2xxan8UjkNrTtPJw.text: I really like this place. Great atmosphere and friendly staff. There was a really long wait (Friday night) which was a negative, but it was worth it. Burgers were great and the rosemary fries amazing! Came here with a group and I think we all want to go back again. I definitely recommend it.

B1Wpapw7lFQBKGuV2B0NNw.text: I'm a celiac so I came to HB to try their gluten-free burger offerings. The beef, red onion relish and lettuce burger on a gluten free bun was awesome - cooked well, and the onion relish was a great sweet-savory topping. The rosemary chips were piping hot and crispy. An all around very good, solid meal. The service was friendly but a little slow as it was quite busy when I went - the place fills up fast, so you may have to wait to get in/be served.

QdwapqM8qsieS39_ydxBKg.text: Awesome atmosphere and service. Very simple menu with few choices, which I thought was very nice and friendly experience for also new customers.

VQjQyFJN2ZA4UYU5xpY37g.text: I had the daily special: a burger with chorizo. It was very good. Typically I've found that British burgers are cooked well done. Honest burgers default is a juicy medium rare. I also enjoyed a Norwegian IPA. The small restaurant was crowded but it was easy enough to find a place at 2 pm on a Friday.

joSB4M7CQp5BHXGLxkjMtQ.text: Cheese burger was nice, but nothing extraordinary. The patty was nice meat, but it just felt like a very simple, honest burger. No thrills.My partner enjoyed the chicken burger and said it was exceptional. So maybe thats worth considering. The Rosemary fries are nice as well, big portions that come with each burger. This is a nice touch, in a city full of burger restaurants that think they can charge separately for fries.Homemade lemonade was cool too, could have been a little bit sweeter but the glass that it came in was brilliant.Only negatives were that there appeared to be construction/building sounds coming from beneath the floors in the restaurant. Very loud banging and drilling that ruined the atmosphere for us and the couple besides us.

OHS83Lio7R5ta880b9gboA.text: The best lunch in London, washed down with ginger beer; absolutely delicious!

Ep0ak--TGSrkxsV2-6Hwbw.text: I was pleasantly surprised that the price of a burger included "rosemary chips". The chips tasted good at first but after about 5 they were just WAY too salty.I went for the veggie burger which was pretty tasty. But didn't cover the saltiness of those chips!

hFeytQsgFptk1aZ41XYZGA.text: This isn't a review for the food but just for the wait. We arrived in the evening and there was already a line. We expected that based on the yelp reviews. However, there wasn't a sheet to take down names. Their waiting list was one waiter who had to remember your name and how many were in your party, in addition to serving other guests their orders. It took us 20 minutes for him to even talk to us to take down our name for party of 2. During that time, we witnessed two disagreements between the waiter and other parties. He apparently thought one group had left when they didn't and another had made a reservation and it somehow got lost. We were told the wait was over 1 hour so we left, went across the street to Barons and were seated right away.

c0AiK-Rm5QFbd_OyeSACuQ.text: Not bad. I was expecting a lot and, somewhat, my expectations were met - but not entirely. The burger was good and, when you factor in the decent portion of chips, the overall meal is of reasonable value. I thought the rosemary chips were alright but I occasionally got a grassy bitterness from them that didn't really do it for me. And back to the burger. I got the cheeseburger with stilton. It was solid, for sure, but I didn't get any 'wow' factor. I'm still giving this place four stars because the food was very good and the service was efficient and friendly. Definitely a worthwhile stop on the London burger circuit.

7ZaS3b7pMMgt0Pw2pShHkA.text: TIMING:   - Arrived at 8:30pm on a Saturday night   - Stood in line for 50 minutes and finally got a seat outsideFOOD:    1. 6 piece chicken wings         - Texture: crunchy with a thick sauce coating         - Seasoning: has a bit of a kick         - Portion: good for 2 people (if having burgers as well)    2. Honest burger (gluten-free bun, meat cooked medium-rare)         - Bun texture: best gluten-free bun I've ever had. Hands down         - Meat texture: cooked perfectly medium         - Chips: crunch level 3/5, but seasoned perfectly         - Seasoning: just right enough to add my own condiments if needed         - Portion: 1 burger was filling enough and there was more than enough fries to go around!    3. Kentucky Tea          - Perfect balance of lemonade and alcoholSERVICE:   - Friendly   - Understanding; we were seated before a group in front of us, and one of the girls said something in a different language. Little did she know, the host spoke the same language and called her out and said there was a table for 2 open when she was with a table of 3. Her ears turned red and she was apologetic. They were seated 5 minutes after us.EXTRA:   - This place is extremely small. I enjoyed sitting outside because it wasn't as loud. Although it was cramped in the corner, I never felt rushed and we enjoyed our time here   - Again, best gluten-free buns I've EVER hadWOULD RECOMMEND?   - Yes! I missed my chance to come here a few years ago and glad I had the chance this year. Will be back the next time I'm in London also!

eup7OMzUGi3jM33be0NbcQ.text: They make some damn good burgers. Got the Honest Burger and it came with fries. HELLA good (yes I'm from the Bay). It was a tad pricey ($15 USD) but so worth. If they dropped the price I'd give it a raver review (is that even a word?). If you have a late night craving they're open till 11pm (I think). Swing by and place an order! It's so worth.

4EDR8l1GllzV8Z8lCTybZQ.text: This branch of London's own legendary burger joint is tucked away in a little side street between Wardour and Dean. A little bit of a puzzle to find but it's basically directly opposite Burger and Lobster if you're on Dean and directly opposite Byron if you're on Wardour. Ironically those two places are also burger restaurants but you'd be mad to miss out on an Honest burger for a £20 burger from B&L or a burger from Byron. Don't get me wrong, Byron's pretty good, but it ain't an honest burger. The place is small and it gets busy most nights. They don't take bookings either so don't you go jumping the gun thinking you've outsmarted us queuers by making a booking. Menu is simple and short. You can't go wrong with a classic honest burger but you can take your pic from the other burgers on the menu. All burgers come with homemade rosemary chips. Chunky like a proper British chip. You can substitute chips with any of the other sides, staff are happy to do that and won't make a fuss.There's always one lager on tap, a gluten beer option, and soft drinks as well as cocktails. Food is excellent. Burgers are always cooked perfectly (medium but on the rarer side of medium.) Service is fast and friendly. Amazing every time. Don't miss it if you're in Soho and want a burger.

ZV0YO3VzNcWQ4hvTWHOmjA.text: Well holy crap, these are some delicious sandwiches. For our first meal in London, we needed something quickly prepared and easily accessible. This was about 7-10 min walk and thankfully there was a table outside as we walked up. After careful debate, we chose to get one of the honest burger and the buffalo chicken special then split the meals. As we had just arrived from Edinburgh by train, I was starving (read: murderously hangry) so we grabbed an order of onion rings when ordering our drinks. The drinks arrived and were delicious. I suggest almost all of the cocktails since we tried 4 of them in our short visit. The onion rings were flipping enormous and audibly crispy. They had fennel or anise in there which gave it quite a different flavor in the batter. Then the sandwiches arrived. Holy crap. That delicious crispy chicken. I will have dreams about you, my darling. Covered in hot sauce and blue cheese, you made my entire being happy. Especially since we had not had a chance to eat much that morning. The burger was delightful. The chips/fries were rosemary flavored and perfectly fried. I would go back here next time in London and that looks super likely in the next few trips.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Specialty buffalo chicken burger.  I want another.
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Onion rings. They are so crispy

cUsMXg7OvucR74ucNYAt9A.text: HB for the win Listen, burgers are not unique to the US anymore. Yes, there was a time when the world turned their noses up at this type of food, but those days are long gone. London, much like Paris and other European cities is going through, or should I say, has already gone through a burger revolution. It's very easy to find a burger that will run circles around a lot of places you'd find in NYC, and Honest is one of those places (honestly...had to don't hate me). We happened upon this place our first day in the city, fresh in from Edinburgh in need of a bite. This place was a pretty easy call, it had simple food, great reviews, and a nice cocktail selection. We grabbed a couple of seats at one of the small tables outside, ordered up some large sized drinks (the spiked lemonade was quite good), and settled in. First up were the spicy onion rings, they were pretty much perfect, large, beer battered (I think), and 100% big enough to split between two people. Speaking of splitting, they had a new buffalo chicken sandwich on the menu that we both wanted to try, so we did half of one each along with half an honest burger. It was SPUER hard to pick which was better, as the burger was really really good, but I think I have to give it to the chicken, it was amazeballs. So there you go, not only is the UK better at burgers now, but they are also better at frying chicken and making it spicy and delcious. The USA is going downhill I tell you.

m81VuuYLIFnQf2-KU79wsQ.text: Went to Soho's Honest as an ambitious group of 8 and miraculously found a table on a Saturday evening. I ordered the following:- BBQ chicken wings- Beef burger with Stilton- Rosemary salted chipsThe wings arrived first and are an interesting take on the barbecued chicken wing. They are more tangy than sweet but it works, especially when combined with the raw spring onion sprinkled on top. There is a satisfying crisp which borders on the chicken being tough to chew on but again this works.I broke my number one rule when ordering burgers and managed to undo the whole point of getting the simplest burger on the menu. I wanted to judge the quality of the patty itself but in adding Stilton, the subtleties in the meat's flavour were lost on me. I love Stilton and I love burgers but not together. I was in a large group ordering under pressure, we all make mistakes.The fries are satisfying and fit into what seems to be a company policy of cooking things for just under too long. They arrive in a beautiful golden brown hue and are basically crisps by the time you reach the small pieces at the bottom. As a fan of slightly burnt food this was paradise. They are more salty than rosemary-ey but that isn't a complaint.It's pretty cramped with a shortage of toilets but with really friendly staff and food cooked to (just short of too long) perfection, Honest is well worth the visit.

j7BLiFb5yIUHa--LkzvHtw.text: Upbeat wait staff, crazy high energy, packed close-together tables, constant chatter & laughter  -- dinner at Honest Burger is the right way to start off a Friday night in Soho. I ordered the vegetarian burger option -- a Fritter consisting of cauliflower, tomato, sweetcorn, shallot, spices, coriander, & cucumber yoghurt. Thankfully the coriander & other spices weren't overpowering, & the pesto sauce I added went well with the flavors of the patty. I'm always looking for a veggie burger that isn't made with black beans & this one went above & beyond with using veggies creatively. The only minus was consistency, which was softer than I would've liked. Honest Burgers are served with Rosemary Salted Chips but I also had to try their onion rings...so good, but so greasy! Cool little spot!

38gClF8iGtl30TjFDk9crQ.text: Honest burgers is a small chain with very authentic burgers that roll with a delicate balance of flavors and great meat. Burgers and burger joints are dime a dozen, so when you find one where the burgers are juicy and not too oversized, where the toppings are balanced for flavors, not to just heap on the fats, that's really cool. This is a nice cozy one, with a great wait staff. Hiding on side street in SOHO, it can get busy, so waits may be a thing. Wait! It's worth it.

AIOXfigncklJQUsN5Xf3xQ.text: Good honest beef, in a no-frills package!Choose your meat (chicken or beef), pick your veggies and toppings - or select one of the house recommendations.  For example; my wife chose the Tribute Burger, and I ate the Honest Burger. Both were excellent! There was a slight smell of pork coming from the bacon, but don't let that trick you - the patties were all beef!  The chips were good, the veggies were fresh, and the burgers were filling. If you are trying to gain weight; you can order double meat & cheese!Standard soft drinks available, as well as limited bar options. The Honest Cup was a vodka drink similar to the live-child from a mule and a mojito. I recommend this drink!  Quick service, and low prices. Try 'em out!

jGdZDEgnSFuBWcGmlquQ0g.text: After craving burgers we tried to decide between going to 'Honest Burgers' and 'Burger and Lobster' but ended up choosing Honest Burger since we had never been. By far the best decision of the night. The 15-20 minute wait outside in the cold rain was worth it. While we waited, one of the waiters would consistently come outside to keep everyone updated on the wait time and make a joke or two. Staff was very personable which made waiting less annoying. After finally getting a seat we ordered the Soho Burger and the limited time Guacamole Burger...both delicious! We opted to get double burgers instead of singles which turned out to be a little too much food but that led to some tasty leftovers. We also ordered a side of the curry sauce which gave the fries an interesting kick of flavor. Overall I said this was probably in my top 5 burgers I've ever had. Go here and thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The Soho Burger

iUcqPmEhOO73P2e6yYKslQ.text: We had a hard time finding flavorful food while on our trip. Honest Burger not only had great staff, but it was the best food we found while in London.

d7q7-5jqd8gxYayOvCS0rg.text: My favorite burger I have ever eaten is from Honest Burgers.  I visited here a year ago, and when I returned to London this year I made sure to stop by three times (even though I've since been vegetarian!).  I always get the "honest burger" and it is amazing- the combination of the sweet onion relish and pickles with the bacon tastes amazing and I'm disappointed that there's nothing like it in the states!  I also recommend the mint lemonade- not as unique but still tastes great!  The atmosphere is great, and if you can try to be seated downstairs- it is a super cute and trendy area that I love!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The "Honest Burger"

gZbn7nBZTEvqtaJjJjlQPw.text: The Fried Chicken sandwich was excellent. So good I forgot take a picture of it. So I did the next thing and took a picture of a picture.. I promise it looks the same and taste amazing!!!

CFwwF-3AMcabgev89Bw_xw.text: Yes!!! This is a slam dunk if you like burgers! You can instantly tell by the passion and enthusiasm the staff has for their burgers and menu that this is going to be a good eating. Their dedication to create high quality burgers and amazing ability to pair them with flavor packed toppings makes this my absolute favorite burger joint in London. They have a "standard" set of burgers on their menu and one limited time special. When I visited it was their Cajun rubbed Louisiana special and it was amazing! Also the onion rings are great if you want a tip for a side.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom

VEHX-zv8SIh932tHpOkO6w.text: We stayed around the corner from this darling place and visited twice. Our son has Celiac and it was perfect for him and us! Small but very good service and the most delicious hamburgers and fries ever. We will miss you!! Our wait the first day was zero minutes and about 5 the second. It is very busy but the owner/manager (not sure of her title) was very accommodating.

tF_s3dR_DadGkAZ5585I5Q.text: For any fan of a good burger who also happens to live a gluten-free life, this place is for you. I had their Soho burger which comes with bacon, mozzarella, pesto, garlic mayo, tomato, and some funky field greens and I couldn't have been happier. Their fries (chips for you Brits) are seasoned with I believe rosemary which is a perfectly compliment to their crispness. I also had the apple, red cabbage, beetroot coleslaw which is not your typical side slaw (I think it was the first thing I finished). And to top it off they have Daura Damm which is IMHO the premier GF beer. Whether you need to be GF or not, this place is doing a mic drop on any other burger shop around. Don't miss it!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Soho Burger on a Gluten-Free bun with the Apple, Beetroot, and Red Cabbage coleslaw with a Daura Damm GF beer. Awesomeness!

nhIJAkTI_2ZWq1pOGnNx6g.text: Let me first start by saying i consider myself a burger connoisseur. I love going to new cities and countries to try their proclaimed "best burger" according to yelp. This place delivers. Very juicy and tasty and flavorful. I got their monthly special burger "the California" similar i suppose to the infamous in n out restaurant in Cali. It was well worth it. And their bbq sauce they use for their wings for the chips (fries) was so freaking good. Almost taste like Mac sauce from McDonald's lol. Top 5 burger I've ever had (probably 5th) but that's VERY GOOD seeing the amount of burgers I've ate in my life.

e8YXQv1OMzyIa_s7Uv5Nbg.text: The London burger scene has improved dramatically over the years, and while Honest Burgers is one of those spots that represents the city's budding burger scene, even Honest Burgers still falls flat in the category that burgers back in the states are quickly mastering: patty flavor. Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?With a reputation for having the best burgers in the city (Next to Patty and Bun and maybe some Byron locations), Honest can play host to some significant lines, but on a Saturday night I only had to wait shy of fifteen minutes before I had my takeaway burger. Service is friendly and accommodating, and the location prime just off the main strip away from the noise and drunk folks. Star Granted. Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?I'm honestly teetering a bit with this one. For years now I've said that no fast casual burger should ever exceed $15.00 (11.61 GBP as of August 2016). My Hometown Burger at Honest came to $16.10 USD, although to be entirely fair it was the menu special that was priced at a significant premium. It wasn't a big burger, but given it was a special I can really only fault myself here. Star Granted. Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?As I alluded to earlier, everything about this burger was good right up until the patty. The bun? Well proportioned, buttery, and fluffy but not to the point of being obtrusive and distracting. The toppings? Marvelous - with bacon, smoked something or another, lettuce, and melted cheese that came together brilliantly. But then, when everything seemed in place as though a London burger joint would finally compete with what's commonplace stateside, the patty fell flat. Walk into a stateside burger kitchen and you'll see salt, pepper, onions, paprika, chorizo, and all kinds of other goodies being grilled right into the raw meat as it evolves into a patty. The result is often a patty so flavorful that you don't even need toppings; and in my opinion that's the measure of a truly special burger. In contrast, my burger patty at Honest fell flat, and was essentially tasteless without help from the toppings. So close!Single Star Granted. Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?All Honest has to do is flavor up their patties and we'll have a winner. Until then, not so much. No Star Granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Special Hometown Burger: 12.50

eHV7YC-KiLk-Nog9bkBb2g.text: I went to honest burgers for the first time and honestly... it was just okay. I went on a weekday in the afternoon around 3 and it was seemingly busy with only a few tables open. When I walked in the two female workers did not acknowledge me, so I walked over to them in the back and they gave me a confused look like, what do you want? Obviously I just walked into your restaurant, I thought it was assumed that I'd like to be seated.  Anyhow, I got seated and ordered a cheeseburger and chips. The food was decent. The burger was smaller than expected but they were generous with the meat portion, so it was fine. The sever (the same one from the beginning) gave me my change and only gave me 6 pounds instead of 12.... ??? I had to go back and tell her she owned me more. I'm not quite sure if this was on purpose or if she was just out of it. I'll give here the benefit of the doubt and say she was out of it. Overall, don't think I'll be coming back here again.

fZ96M1pk6-nrtNMl9mKt8g.text: GLUTEN FREE BUNS!!! IN LONDON!!!I was pleasantly surprised to find this place on yelp - I was super craving a burger and can't do gluten (I notice gluten-free may be a newer trend in the UK?). Anywho, happened upon this place and BOY is it tasty :) Simple menu, gf buns, I had the Honest burger - excellent red onion relish, added bacon and the burger tasted even better (though it was terrific without), and the chips are made with rosemary salt?! Yum. Who has 2 thumbs and loved her burger here? This girl.

3Rv_3hKabiGOW4RV5pKyLA.text: I'd heard great things about this place but it was really disappointing.Bad burgers, bad chips - both had a really funny taste. The restaurant (Kings Cross) was also sterile and boring.  Not a patch on places like meat liquor and dirty burger.

Nncqgy_vaGbrJ8wmdYckxQ.text: After a visit to Honest Burgers, I am really tempted to take one star off Tommi's Burgers. I absolutely love this place.Located on one of those side alleys across Dean Street, I might have found it difficult to locate had I not been with my girlfriend, who knows every inch of Soho inside out.It is a tiny, cozy place with some of the friendliest people you can have serving you burgers. Although the interiors are not as funky as Tommi's, I found this place definitely more comfortable.The burger itself was heaven. It was the perfect medium rare. The bacon and the cheese balanced out the flavors excellently.And they serve Samuel Smith Ales, which is just beautiful. I do think the chips were a bit too much on the "homefries" side, but then, I guess I'm just spoiled by fries in Toronto.So 9 bucks for a burger? I don't mind, if they continue serving burgers from heaven.

9TCBJTOeXs_1kQG8a9v40Q.text: A really nice venue selling burgers through simplicity. A few experimental flavours but generally they sell the classics. I went with the Tribute, an American style burger with streaky bacon, American cheese, burger sauce and mustard and pickles. A great combination of ingredients but too much sauce masked the beef and bacon flavour.Chips are served in the price of the meal which is nice as many burger joints nowadays count them separately. The chips were excellently done with Rosemary and a hint of lemon. They rounded off the meal really well and I think by the end they were the part I most enjoyed. Daily cocktail for £5, served in a jar, was a nice drink to compliment the meal and prevent it being too heavy. Today's was gin, cucumber, and lemon. Perfect before a show if you can get a table. It's a really small restaurant, seating about 30, but they have a fairly quick turnover rate and the possibility of booking ahead. The size is one of the reasons I enjoyed the place so much, it wasn't loud but it had energy.

zegrdeDoFqI-mhVAxTKs_w.text: Positive: The burger is among the best you can currently get in London, topped only by the burgers at the Hawksmoor and Goodman's. It's much cheaper than the steakhouses, so Honest Burgers comes out as a winner.Negative: There is a no reservations policy here, but also a distinct lack of a "no lingering" policy, so you might end up waiting for a while. They do take your mobile number and will call you when a table becomes free, but in practice this just isn't as good as taking bookings for at least some tables.

It9X-aeriYnfF0X1lY6L-A.text: great burgers and fries! cozy and relazing enviroment, I'll be back for sure

DJBCElfoTxr23y4IT8OebA.text: The Honest Burger was delicious, caramelized onions, pickles and relish were great. We got there early (exactly Noon) and it is good we did because by 1 it was packed! The service was really good but I didn't particularly like the rosemary chips.

KdRogWXBhebyHN1_QFFDiA.text: Ugh Honest Burgers I had such high expectations for you. After reading the mountain of insanely positive reviews on Yelp, I wandered to Meard Street to try one for myself, and left quite disappointed. When I arrived it was full but one table, which I was given. I instantly loved the feel of the place. It feels like a vintage cafe in Brighton or somewhere by the sea, and decent music was playing over the speakers. The food at people's tables looked great and I was excited. I chose The Federation Burger; a £13.50 special that was just basically the Honest Burger, but double the cheese, patty and bacon. It came out with rosemary chips after about 15 minutes, and I inspected. The burger patties were nicely medium cooked, the bacon was a bit overdone, and for some obscure reason the onion relish and pickles were put on both the top of the burger under the top bun, and at the bottom of the burger under the bottom patty, which automatically made the bottom bun really soggy and it disintegrated almost as soon as I lifted it. The whole thing was just a bit lacklustre. It was dry and flavourless, and the rosemary chips started excellent but then left your mouth feeling really gritty and got sickening quickly. I'm hoping that I've just had a bad experience, and it was in no way bad enough for me not to return, but if my next experience is similar then there probably won't be a third.On a positive note, the cloudy lemonade in a little jug is absolutely delicious. I would happily drink 100 glasses of it. Yum.

OrLLE60okOFk_8-gqy4bxw.text: A place has to have passed the test if you want to make plans to back in a week much less the next day. I haven't had enough burgers in London to know if theirs are the best, but our group was well pleased. Chips are included in the price and they are fantastic, not sure we've argued over whether chips had a secret ingredient before this.The lemonade, while it looks A+, is really only for non-yanks. To reiterate, show up early or list and then pub it for an hour or two. It's worth it.

OeUE0h2dUfnyhROrCBO8MA.text: Best burger place ever...the burgers are so fresh and simple..the fries are yummy...highly recommended but be ready to wait in line, especially at the Soho branch

kaDy-EYd-MZY8K7LGIUAeg.text: I nearly gave this place a five-star rating, as the food is amazing and the staff is exceedingly kind. However, the slightly cramped space and the relatively small size of the burgers kept me from doing so. Regardless, this really is the place to go to if you want a nice, juicy burger.

UPjikTvLVNWOva1nMV_n6A.text: In addition to being absolute tourists, this past week Erica and I have been exploring a bit of London with our friends Matt and Lea. In a quest to find a great burger around here, we stumbled upon a place called Honest Burgers that isn't too far from where we're staying in Soho.They have a really straightforward--honest--menu. A chicken burger, a beef burger (options for cheese or "Honest" with bacon, red onion relish, lettuce, cheddar, and pickles), and a fritter vegetarian burger sandwich thing.A Honest beef burger with fries and a soda costs £10.5 (about $16.5) making it one of the more expensive meals I've written about.An Honest Burger: beef, red onion relish, smoked bacon, mature cheddar, pickled cucumber and lettuce.On a Sunday night, it seemed not too busy, though it is a rather small place so you might see a little wait before you can have a seat.One bite into this burger and I was honestly amazed. It wasn't anything fancy, it was just that they managed to do it exactly right. The meat was cooked perfectly medium rare. The relish was surprisingly amazing. The real English bacon was heavenly. It's not a large burger, but I can say it was the perfect size.The chips (french fries) were wonderful. Served beautifully with a rosemary salt which gave them a unique and very tasty flavor.Having been away from America for the past week, I thought my opinion might've been easily swayed. Tonight, we visited Honest Burgers again. All four of us. Lo and behold, it was again amazing. Had to double check. Big fans all around, every single one of us enjoyed it.

OeKa1oSLYR4-EwO2eLJtQQ.text: Great food, however a waitress called my girlfriend and I 'gentlemen'. She's got pretty short hair, but that was uncalled for.

ngAOVNWQuEZCj2nhXte_lQ.text: Excellent burger, we were delighted to see that almost everything on the menu was available gluten free!

TlfYGCjDVYSTQTfBjgIqCQ.text: Such a disappointment! I have gone the one in oxford circus. The burger is okay, chips was good but the service and the behaviour of the waitress lead my to write this comment.. Only one of us want to drink an alcohol and her comment was awkward : real girl... The way she serves food was rude and the moment we finish our food, she came by : I guess you wont order more??!! At the end, as the music is unnecessary loud , my friend told her how many she should charge from credit card, she didnt understand and we repeated... And she said.. I'm not deaf!!! Etc etc Seriously.. There isnt any fuss about this resto..

yYqpDgPBLW-5VXtCOtWV3g.text: Burgers are delicious! They melt in your mouth. They come out medium however you can request for them to be cooked to your liking. My favourite is the honest burger itself. It comes with chips.. And a lot of chips! A meal is around £10 and well worth it. Great atmosphere as well.

MLkXCkun5rCWGB523d6e4Q.text: All right hipsters, groom your handlebar moustaches, and don your black thick rim specs, flannel shirts and suspenders!  Roll up your sleeves to show off your ill-thought tatoos and tuck your 'vintage' jeans into your grey wool socks!  Last, but certainly not least, load up Instagram on you iPhone and head here!This place is quite entrenched in the hipster, rustic, country-side, simplistic, limited menu cliche motif (which I'm getting tired of)... but damn their food is good! It's the rightful new food equation sweeping the nation of a few high quality, simple ingredients, doing their thing dancing on your  taste buds.I think I've tried all the few (four?) burger options, all fantastic, with their minimal ingredients both coming together, and standing apart , in near perfect harmony.  The 3 times I've been here, the burgers have come more rare than the medium-rare requested, so if you're bothered by that (which I'm not), I suggest to set your expectations of what you want with the waitress when placing your order.I've tried to make their rosemary chips at home, to no avail.... they are the best, most flavorful chips I can remember.  Their green salad and coleslaw are pretty darn tasty too.A whole meal with beer/wine is a bit  more expensive than Byron and GBK, but I reckon is worth it.  This is our new favourite burger restaurant.

9Gv6ICHOCF_A6y4H8woWQw.text: My favourite burger place in townShort but good menu, burgers grilled to perfection with amazing rosemary fries ! Highly recommended

vpXr4nMtzJD3ttxjASUV5A.text: We only waited for about 20 mins before we got our seats on Saturday afternoon. The menu is simple and both my partner and I picked the Louisiana burger.The patty was very juicy and well seasoned. We were half way through the burger before we found out that there wasn't any cheese! A burger without cheese?! Wow! That was a first for both of us but we think that the flavour combination of the burger (the relish, the blood lettuce, the cajun spice, the bloody mary sauce) was good enough!Oh and the chips with rosemary salt were AMAZING! so crunchy and again well seasoned!Can't wait to go back and try their original burgers!

m6orbS_pfJhJchFTM29O9g.text: Honestly, a really good burger place.Clean, wooden tables with no coverings or unnecessary flowers in pound-shop vases. Clean chairs, small space but cosy and actually the type of space I like to sit, eat, people watch, chat or get up close & personal with my food.A black board with the limited, but good food choices is on the wall - although they do have a menu with the same.I like these places that don't spend ooo-gobs of cash on over complicating a space but instead concentrating on the food and service. They do it very well here.I don't do queues or waiting for food and I didn't have to here. Arrived just after they opened and got a seated right away. Order taken and I checked out the scene while smelling those burgers cooking. I think I got a bit excited. I was here to check out the Brew Burger (featured for 1 month only). I passed on the matching Bourbon Baby brew (don't eat or like chocolate flavours) but the server recommended the Big Wave. It's a Hawaiian beer with very light citrus undertones - this helped with the fries; more on those below...All the burgers are cooked medium. I had to minus the bacon & cucumber which they were happy to accommodate. Juicy and flavourful. It's a finger lickin', two napkin burger. The 1st of two slight negatives are the fries. Rosemary fries - no big deal IMO and the Brew Burger could stand alone without them. The flavour of the fries was slightly masked because they were overly salty & a bit overcooked. They do have other sides but frankly, the burger is the star of this show.Even though it's small & people do queue here, you are not rushed to give up your table. Very good service. No constantly interrupting you mid-bite either. They balance things just right here.I more than like this place & I'll be sure to make a return visit....oh, that second slight negative? The music could be turned down a bit so patrons don't have to raise their voices to talk.

QOXB16DUuxCuuVyb_w9nZg.text: Me and my friend were walking by this restaurant and decided to give it a try. We entered this burger holy land with empty stomachs and full of hope. As we sat down on the throne of the burger gods we knew we were in store for a delightful lunch. We ordered the house special. As I looked up from the throne of burger gods I was sitting on I saw this golden bunned and juicy burger sitting infront of me. The meat was oozing juices like the finest nectar of the lands. As I caressed the burger the bun was glowing like the most beautiful sun I have ever seen. As I bit into the burger my taste buds exploded with delight. It was like I died and was being revived by the magical power of this burger. I would travel back to London just to eat at this magical burger joint.

YVLjViwNKOCsOG5UbcUovQ.text: We´ve been three times: The first was amazing. Great burger (not perfect, but close) and perfect chips. The second was good. The chips were still the best we had tried in London, and the burger was pretty standard.The last time we went was awful. We ordered the special, which came with a sauce, cheese and bacon. The bun had a tiny stain (which I guess was the sauce because we couldn´t find it anywhere else), it only had HALF A SLICE OF BACON and the chips were mediocre this time. Their meat is outdoor bred, which is why we chose them over the other tastier burger in London. It´s a shame, we used to love it. Perhaps they´re getting too comfortable?

cN-qi1rj1HPs9XDhvg1p4A.text: First visit for lunch today, and to be honest (pun fully intended) it was a bit of a let down.The wait was expected, but as is the trouble with similar no booking spots, the service was almost painfully slow and found the atmosphere a bit awkward.Burgers were only ok, and not sure why everyone seems to love the chips as I found them over salted and chewy. Three stars for a decent burger at good prices but there are far better places for a burger in this city!

b3MVeeyKj84Q0xA38Y3Wxg.text: I have been on a huge burger mission since the start of the year. Attempting to leave no stone unturned and no patty of moo-cow un-eaten!I have tried a lot of places. I have eaten a lot of burgers. But none that have compared to the greatness that Honest Burgers has been offering me for a long, long time. I must admit I have been holding off on reviewing this place for a while because I needed some London hamburgers to compare it to. And guess what? Honest are still undefeated champions in my estimation!They cook the burgers to pinky perfection (although they are more than happy to serve it however you would prefer) and conseal them in a perfect, yet slightly sweet tasting bun. I have tried all of the variants that they offer here, but still my favourite is the plain classic simple hamburger - everything within is just perfect. The sweetness of the onion relish as it balances off the taste of the bun and the salty beef patty. Heaven! Combining this with what I believe to be my favourite chips currently being served in London and you have a heavenly combo. I think that Byron burgers are pretty good. However, I really feel that their standard of chips to let them down, and compare these to the rosemary salted Honest chips and you are really in a different league.I think that they have done a good job in establishing the decor here that now runs cohesively through the rest of the Honest branches. Nothing too swish, more of a "shack" concept than fine dining, but I feel that this fits well within the context of eating a hamburger.The staff are trained well, on the whole. Without being over the top, they serve you well and have yet to let me down.They offer a number of craft beers which I cannot really comment upon as I do not drink beer! However, I do often have their Honest cocktail which is a gin & cucumber-based affair and this is really great. Another area where I think that they do well is that they do not add a service charge to the bill. I always feel that you inevitably get better service when the staff are actually working for their tip as opposed to knowing that very few people will ever question that it is on the bill. And with Honest, they do it right!So all in all, well done Honest! You are my favourite burger in London!

w3taxLcxuUeyFUaAowDTAw.text: Some of the best burgers in town. Get ready to queue for them though. They are constantly innovating with their flavours which makes it an exciting place to be not just once. They have fairly ok craft beer options to go with the burgers.

mGqhnxH6lT0UP-SfooQEXQ.text: Delicious burgers! Love the classic Honest Burger. All the burgers come with amazing Rosemary fries which are included in the price.

GQXco87nSNDyAkKWI7Ip9g.text: Well, don't really know what to say about this place. That's a first, to be honest. I could give an ontological description of the guests, the staff and the cute dogs at the door. But fact is: burger is an Art here. And honest: says it all. Worth a trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Cute doordogs!

2AJQJaKHFUMp-3iNKs_LPQ.text: This was my first visit to Honest Burger and I've got to say that I was rather impressed by the food.I order the cheese beef burger with onion rings. Chips comes with the burger and they were amazing, it was like the crispy bits you get with fish and chips but it was all crispy.The burger was really tasty with onion relish, a nice juicy burger which just melts in your mouth.Unlike some places where I find the burger is just OTT trying to cram as many ingredients into it as possible, Honest Burger have done quite a nice job to give you the perfect sized burger.

rE_NkMifBL0sLKrRGtWGew.text: This surely is one of the most famous burger joints around London. I've been there several times and I can say that sometimes the guys tend to get slowish. I don't know what they're doing but I do like to think that they're preparing the meat and chips to a whole new level of tastiness. Well, I guess that the wait is worth it as the burgers are truly delicious. The buns are soft on the inside and toasted on top and bottom and make the perfect covers for the meat which is oh, so heavenly rich in flavour. There are lots of items on their menu but I'd definitely go with the burger. As I said, the sluggish service is not a constant thing but I guess it come to luck if the place would be crowded.

Cs2yqpeX4JEZ_nTvVQIY6g.text: Swing by a good hour before you intend to eat to get your name on the list.I really like Honest Burgers, I also love how they do business. On the food front, they constantly deliver perfectly pink and wholesome burgers, with great accompanying ingredients. You really couldn't go wrong the way they do things. The chips are also top notch with their rosemary salt. Contrary to raving about food, I'm going to talk about the Honest Burger experience. This is the burger place I come to most frequently. It's not my favourite burger of them all, but they make coming here so easy. So you roll up to Meard st, which in itself is a great little cobbly road where you can see suckers dining at Wahaca, and the recently added Bunnychow (not sure about this joint), on the other end there's Burger and Lobster, Duck Soup and Cay Tre. You'd really struggle to go wrong here. But tucked away tidily is HB. Just before the tummy grumbles ensue, I would guide my devoted attendee(s) through Soho, traversing all the delectable delights of this little hub, stop by HB to put my name down, then continue on for happy hour cocktails, froyo or ice-cream. There's plenty to keep you occupied in and around Soho. A spot of shoppping up in Carnaby St never did anyone harm either. You'd check your phone from time to time and HB docks your digit ever-closer to 1. I've never seen a 0 on the webpage - but I do know that means my table is ready for me.HB is a great dining experience, I would rather wonder than wait outside on a cold evening (Patty&Bun). I understand that queues are good PR, but I just want to enjoy my food, and I'm sure you'll all agree that our time is valuable. Thank you HB for respecting that.Happy waiting - it's just up to you to find the best wait possible.

wC0TFOVotI2rrLrHpP5Meg.text: Great burgers & chips, good drinks, nice staff. Burgers are not the biggest in town, but enough to satisfy without bloating.Service was very attentive and fast; we were lucky not to have to queue (arriving around 18:45 on a Thursday; there was a queue forming outside about 10 minutes later)Definitely going again.

jwejjmp05GV6_a36G_Mggg.text: Honest Burger is my favourite burger joint in London. The American and Louisiana burgers remain my favourite of their specials, even enticing me to travel to the portobello road restaurant to get my mitts on the American which is permanently on the menu there.Being gluten free I love that they are one of the only burger places in London that offer gluten free buns. They even have gluten free beer. The burgers themselves are high quality meat and cooked pink (or more if you prefer). Read: super tasty. And only a tenner including chips, which is why I'm in there on average once a week. Scrummy!

WMXvmcDECDNSLRpayQ2Iow.text: Honest burgers are my favorite burger joint in London! Delicious, moist and full of flavor... this chip is even better!!!! and you must try the 'honest beer' - so good! It gets super busy at weekend but mid week after work would be the best timke to go.

26rNyvbTBovg0pGtQYg40w.text: Two burgers in two nights. And as a red blooded American I can tell you these folks have it nailed. If you are in London you must stop in!

O2r-HtfeG9B_e1FglbhfiQ.text: Holy crap this place is so good! It's so good I can't believe I'm not eating one of their burgers right this very second.Not only won't they balk at rare requests (suck it, City of London) but your order is guaranteed to come out beautifully red and ready to be devoured. The rosemary fries aren't to be sneezed at, but they're drastically overshadowed by the meat.These are the best burgers in London, and I don't throw out that title casually. I've probably had burgers in dozens of locales from seedy to swanky, and Honest takes the cake by leagues.The last time I was here the special was basically a holiday burger, and while it was a great deal pricier than the standard (~£13 vs. £8-9.5) man it was GOOD. Of course, how can you go wrong with Camembert on a perfectly cooked slab of beef?

62DcnaUskf6jTxolL5dI5A.text: BEST BURGER EVERWe've been twice now, both times our ordered medium rare burgers came out perfectly.  This may be the only place I've ever been to where I don't need the salt and pepper on the table because these burgers were seasoned perfectly.  This time I got the 'honest' which has cheese and bacon, probably the best burger I've ever had.  I've had a lot.  The fries came out hot and crisp delicious and perfect.I'll keep looking, but for now this is my new favourite burger place

Jusvyo48NH1d7SnWQ9Z2xw.text: There isn't a lot in terms of options to eat but man, they have some tasty burgers!  I had the Honest Burger, which was thick and juicy and the Rosemary chips, which I had heard about.  The chips (fries for those in the U.S.) were crispy and flavorful, while the burger itself was just the right size, with a plump patty.  Just be sure if you drop by, to be prepared to wait as the place is pretty small and quite popular.  They're open till 11 p.m. on most days but if you go late, make sure you get there way before 10 as there could be a queue of people waiting and they won't add any more to the list.Definitely a must for anyone visiting London and in the mood for a good burger.  I visited in late November for a week and came here twice.

qmHrYfLMDMqMs4k4TGEQoA.text: One of the best burgers I have ever had in my entire life! I even made it my final meal in London, it was well priced, probably the cheapest burger I found in all of Europe and it was absolutely delicious! I got the cheese burger and it was juicy and amazing I recommend it to anyone of my friends or family members traveling to London.

gLiXY7lQOypmJsszmiZ0SA.text: I have been a number of times to Honest but always felt I needed to give them a second chance. The queues are long but you can leave your mob number and they'll give you a call. Great for the continued exploration of the local pubs!I ordered the burger with fries and on every occasion I felt unsatisfied even after making omissions to the burger (red onion relish wtf?) My main boozer is just down the road so this is very convenient on a Friday or Saturday night. The burger is cooked well the slice of cheese doesn't get a chance to melt and the listless lettuce is unappealing, but at least its served on a sourdough type bun. The fries are great but I think I made my last visit to Honest Burgers - honest!

ihNOvavKjTOZpVL6qCw9_g.text: Had the honest burger, special and the ipa. Burgers are mediocre at best, not sure what we're excited about here but it was just ok for us. Decent meat and meh toppings, nothing exciting or creative with a large wait. Staff was excellent and accommodating.

FcBvKGedfKq8YdrY1-1dqw.text: The first time we tried to have dinner here after a show at the Soho Theatre - we were told it was about a 2 hour wait.  Clearly we should've put our name down before the show.  2nd time we were a bit smarter and did just that and talk about good timing, we got a text as soon as the show was over.  About 30 min sooner than the expected wait time but all worked out.I like that there is a simple menu.  I debated between the honest burger and the special which was the American but I have to say I much prefer cheddar over American cheese any day.  We also ordered a side of pork cheek scratching with a chipotle dip - definitely wasn't what I expected.  It was more like bacon strips and was a really small portion for 3.50.  I most likely won't order that again.  I really liked the red cole slaw - it does break up the greasiness from the burger and fries a bit.The burger was really good.  I was tempted to sprinkle a bit of salt or ketchup to it.  As everyone says, the fries are definitely top notch.  I think we got the bottom portion of the bunch 'cuz it was all broken up pieces - still really good especially with the Rosemary.Overall, it was really good.  I'd definitely want to come back and check out the veggie burger but something tells me it's probably not any healthier than the beef or chicken ones.

qG3Cj6MINm9rC1-BbKAdIA.text: I had a cheeseburger with fries here, and the coleslaw. Overall it was an ok experience, but not great, there are many better burger places closeby.I eat my burgers well-done (just Google "fecal matter in burgers" and you can see why!), which you have to ask for here. What I got was a completely dried out patty with a very "off" consistency. I know burgers can be well-done and still juicy - I eat them all the time - so how they got it this dry, I don't know, it was a first. The relish was overpowering all other taste in the burger, so eating the burger was like eating red onion relish on bread. A red onion sandwich basically. Not great. And not a burger.The rosemary fries tasted great, but we're oddly chopped in tiny, tiny pieces, it was like a crumble of fries at the bottom of the plate. Why serve these? Made no sense. They are included in the price which is good value - no extra cost.I didn't get any water until I had finished eating, so clearly service is very very stretched here. Nice enough, but waiting 20 min on water is not great.  No napkins either, had to take them from a table next to mine.Weirdly they had no mustard on the tables - just ketchup and mayo.So all in all this place seemed to have potential, but very poorly executed and managed, it seems. It wasn't horrible, just not good. I wouldn't eat a burger here again.

0ldCJYKumEpuxUUmRtYkog.text: Really great visit to Honest burgers as always. The waitress did say "good evening gentlemen" to me and my boyfriend, but I'm deffos a woman! I do have short hair though, and we all laughed a lot, so I'll let her off! The Rosemary chips are particularly good and their homemade lemonade is great. It's super busy at weekends but this time we went straight after work on a Monday and managed to get a table without any trouble, so midweek early evenings are definitely the best time to go.

VcTWCbXObnTbqQPMsbqOLQ.text: My friends were really craving for a burger, so we met outside Honest, and we were told we have to wait for an HOUR, but my friend was really "locked" on that place. so we were queuing, they have an app or sth that tells you your place in the queue and sends a text to head back to the restaurant when you're up.So we went to have coffee, just so we won't freeze outside waiting, it took about 45 minutes but we got in, the place is pretty small yet crowded, we got a small table [we were 3] but managed to squeeze inMy friend was already super hungry so he ordered 2 burgers, and I ate a burger earlier today but couldn't resist their look and smell so I ordered one too.It took some time but the atmosphere was nice and the staff is cool... and our food arrived.Honest cocktail is really yummy, the home-made lemonade however is not too great - I love the jar cups. The burgers are pretty small but well made, quality beef, great aromas and the fries are pretty awesome.We ordered the honest burger, plain burger [just beef] and a cheese burger, as extra we also took some onion rings which are really yummy, and I put one in my burger - awesome upgrade!The bun is fresh and soft, and makes the whole thing even better.They also have Tabasco sauce. happiness! :DHad a really good experience and good time. too bad the burgers are so small.

b8c_eBxW9mjTdylZMMLvSw.text: Great location. Unique interior - took me back to an old school retail feel.Servers were helpful and unobtrusive. One of them had an awesome moustache.Burgers are fantastic. Good meat, cooked perfectly pink in the middle. Pickles and onion jam complement the meat and brioche bun superbly.Fries are great, the rosemary salt working perfectly. Slightly over generous with said salt though.The bloody-mary-ketchup is super tasty.Drinks are fun and served in jars. The lemonade and ginger beer being particularly good.Overall, would definitely recommend a visit. And a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. inside The Federation
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. Lemonade - jar style
Photo of Honest Burgers - London, United Kingdom. The Federation

WjDCgTFQAqvtsUqiEGAYTw.text: My boyfriend is on a constant hunt for the best burger in the world. So, naturally, upon hearing all of the great things about Honest Burgers, we had to stop by when we found ourselves in London.We ordered the Honest Burger, the Specialty Burger, and two jars of their home-made lemonade. The Specialty Burger tasted a bit muddled to me (a lot of flavors going on that didn't really work), but the Honest Burger was absolutely amazing. A perfect medium pink (or medium rare as we Americans like to call it), just the right amount of toppings, and simply delicious. While this isn't the best burger that we've ever had, this definitely makes it to the top. The side of fries is also sprinkled with rosemary salt, giving it a unique herbal flavor that I've never tasted in fries before.Oh, and don't skip out on the lemonade. It's sweet, tart, refreshing, and perfect to go with your burger :)

sbucvKOMorhVln9ZgRhQAw.text: England food wouldn't get such a bad rep if more people visited this place. I tried a honest burger, prepared with smoked bacon, lettuce, pickles and red onion. It was nothing short of amazing, one of the best burgers I had in my life.I also had the house cocktail and it was pretty good, prepared with gin, cucumber, apple juice and lemon puree. They also have a house beer which I wanted to try, but as I had other places to visit, perhaps it was for the best that I didn't drink too much during lunch hahaOverall London treated me pretty well and HB was no exception, service here was awesome.

rOO--qnDtaufH-3PtPgxGA.text: This is a damn good burger. Honest.I had discussed going down to Brixton to visit some friends who live in the area, but then we decided to check out the chocolate festival at the London Film Museum, so I suggested we just hit up this branch of Honest Burgers (as he wanted to try it as well, but the queue was too long when he went by).So we came for lunch. There were three of us, and while there isn't a lot on the menu (a chicken burger, three beef burgers, a veggie burger, and usually some sort of special burger), we all found something that we were craving. I went with the special. It was a beef burger with Welsh Monterey Jack (Haha. When did people start making American cheeses outside of the US?), grilled courgettes and a spicy slaw (can't remember if it was chipotle or habanero).So yeah, the burger was awesome. I love how it comes medium (although it was much pinker than medium, more medium-rare I think) standard. Burgers should not be well-done in my book. Pink and rare and juicy in the middle is the way to go. And these were juicy. And delicious. And the slaw was amazing.Oh and they come with chips! Not just any chips, but ROSEMARY chips. And Rosemary is my favorite herb (pronounced 'erb). But they weren't overwhelming in Rosemary, they were just perfect. And they were crisps and fluffy. These chips are outstanding. And they come with the burger!I will definitely be heading back here. Lunch on a Saturday was surprisingly easy to get in for, but the place was pretty full by the time we left!

IL58oFsL_uB8qwCpCvn4Rg.text: Tasty burgers the meat was so tasty and cooked to perfection the fries were yummy and freshly cooked it was just over all very tasty although the place was quite small it was totally worth it (:

j3WuM_N5c0jCHM6sGI-zQg.text: Went here twice with no queue, the burgers are probably the best I've ever had so far. The chips are also delicious.

oxnYK70KRV9iK5XoAEdgRg.text: The best news of the summer wasn't Team GB's dramatic rise in the gold medal standing, but rather that Brixton's Honest Burgers was opening a branch in Soho. if you haven't been, Honest Burgers serves the best burgers in London you can get for under 10 quid. The meat is as fresh as it gets---they source from the Ginger Pig (top notch butcher). Get the Honest Burger --- comes with smokey bacon, some delicious onion relish on a freshly made bun. All burgers come with Honest Burgers signature rosemary salted chips. While at the Brixton location, you can often expect queues of 1+ hours, this location is new and semi-hidden on the alleyway that is Meard Street...so no queues! Go here now, before the masses find out that they no longer have to trek down south to get a rather honest burger.

2Zxxap1qErLgCzzmUS8pPQ.text: We arrived at about 5pm on a Monday - it was already about half full and quickly became quite busy. We were served fairly quickly. Simple menu seems to equate to quick service.The burger was excellent - Stilton cheese burger (although I think I would opt for mature chedder next time). The chips were lovely and the coleslaw had apple in which gave it a lovely sweet flavour. Another bonus was the unlimited sparkling water.Good prices, fast service and delicious burgers make this place a win.

p7BFopgktwihA1p7ziJFEw.text: Look I'm from Texas the land of cowa and bullshiy, I know a good hamburger and what quality meat tastes like. This was one of the best hamburgers I have ever had in my life. This place has been blessed by the Meat gods with amazing ingenuity.

IrhVlqicrEGc16MKql6gkw.text: During my quest for the perfect burger in London, a friend told me to try Honest Burgers. And damn, she was right !You can tell by the queue outside, that Honest Burgers are good ones. The place is really small, so we ate outside on the heated small terrace (even if it was raining). But the wait was worth it : the burgers are juicy and the beef patty are large ! But I have to admit, my favourite part were the rosemary chips : so good !!And don't forget to try the curry sauce. It comes with an extra (1£ if I remember correctly) but it's so good you'll end up licking it from your finger)

sEvuUueNbWAWdwFaFvVsuw.text: Good burgers, they seemed small at first, but for me it was more than enough. The fries (chips) were covering most of my plate, and they were pretty good too! You can get unlimited water (still or sparkling) for just £1 a person. Staff was friendly :)

2XafXRDKoo6GgWbsEQbMfw.text: Simply the best burger (and fried onion rings) I ever had!Also recommended: the homebrew Pale AleGreat staff. Enjoyed my dinner :)

XVv09xjJE_GvjtxSrxrePQ.text: How I didn't put on weight on our trip is frankly a miracle, because burgers were our go-to meal and we had a lot of them over the six weeks.Honest was one of the best we had, we agreed that one other place in Portugal had burgers slightly better but their chips were sad, crispy (burnt) bits and these Honest chips were flawless. So as an overall burger & chips ensemble Honest was the best we had. If you like blue cheese in general, try their burger with it in. Don't be scared, it's a fearfully delicious pairing.

t5eNosm8XaKujm8OR0M4pg.text: After a day of walking around Marylebone and soho we stopped here. It was about 2:30 so there wasn't a line.  The burgers here are the best I've ever had!!! They are juicy, cooked on the rarer side  of medium, with onion relish and any other condiments.  The burgers are huge!! We didn't think we'd be able to finish them....but we did! And the fries, the fries with rosemary were Devine.  Friendly service too.  Can't recommend this one enough.

nziaDJLSr0zQk8NyBINImg.text: This place was amazing and affordable.  Great for kids, gluten free, I ordered the onion rings but the fries were so much better!!
